subject: Electric Systems Inspired by the Food Chain
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Explore the Unknown Strengths of Fluid Power 10.01.2020 Infographic: What is the New Normal for Engineering Workplaces? ASME Market Intelligence has been surveying more than 1,500 engineers in industry and academia on their experiences during the COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on engineering. Learn about their responses in this infographic. Sponsored Ad How the Food Chain Can Keep the Electricity Flowing Whether intended or not, engineered, industrial systems often mirror those found in the natural world. Drawing on principles from biodesigned systems - in this case the food web - will help scientists at Texas A&M University build more resilience into the electrical power grid. ASME TechCast: The Unknown Strengths of Fluid Power Fluid power systems are capable of impressive strengths and refined movements. Used in industries that range from construction to aerospace, hydraulic and pneumatic systems provide transmission capabilities comparable to electronic and mechanical actuation systems. Alan Hitchcox talks with Mechanical Engineering about the unknown strengths and innovations in today's fluid power systems. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Remote Threats: Insider Risk and the Remote Work Paradigm October 26 | 2 pm ET It's a new world for businesses everywhere. Learn the indicators professionals look for in potential problem employees and review the motivations that drive employees to cross the line. Get equipped with strategies and questions you should ask your leadership to better protect your company in these unprecedented times. subject: Why is Diversity in Engineering a Major Opportunity?
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Designers Should Employ Human Factors Engineering 10.02.2020 Infographic: COVID-19 Creates a Remote Learning Curve Engineers working at academic institutions have seen significant changes on campus since spring. Most tellingly, professors and instructors see the enthusiasm for remote learning tools diminishing as time goes on. Sponsored Ad Human Factors Engineering: Why Engineers Should Do More of It Human factors engineering (HFE) and usability studies during product design almost always improve a product's performance. Benefits of HFE include improved product performance and user experience, but why is it not commonly used by mechanical design engineers? Why is Diversity in Engineering a Major Opportunity? Minorities and women are gaining ground in STEM. Diversity has become a marquee issue today and one that major companies, educators, and governments are actively engaged in trying to solve. The future of engineering will depend significantly on diversifying education and professional opportunities. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Remote Threats: Insider Risk and the Remote Work Paradigm October 26 | 2 pm ET It's a new world for businesses everywhere. subject: 5 Smart Engineering Startups
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Digital Engineering During COVID-19 10.06.2020 Sponsored Content Video: 5 Smart Engineering Startups Small startup companies can be nimble enough to find clever solutions to vexing problems. Here we highlight five startups that have developed some innovative answers to everyday questions. Sponsored Ad Digital Engineering During COVID-19 The COVID-19 pandemic is speeding the adoption of digital engineering technologies. The pandemic has forced many engineers into work-from-home situations. Digital engineering tools that support remote work and distributed collaboration are being considered more thoroughly than ever before. Sponsored Content What are the Differences Between IEC Power Supply Protection Classes? Understanding the three IEC Power Supply Protection Classes enables those specifying or selecting power supplies to choose the appropriate class of supply based upon safety, regulatory, and cost constraints. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Design and Optimization of a BMR Loudspeaker Drive Unit October 15 | 2 PM ET Balanced mode radiator drive units are experiencing widespread adoption due to their full bandwidth, wide directivity radiation field that is primarily decoupled from their physical size. Although the diaphragm behavior is unique, the remaining key elements of the drive unit, such as the motor and suspension structures, require similar optimization to conventional drive units. COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® will highlight some of the key design steps, including incorporating the Magnetic Fields, Solid Mechanics, and Pressure Acoustics physics interfaces. subject: Turbo Expo - Abstract Deadline Extended
body: Abstract Deadline Extended to October 14 Abstract Deadline Extended ASME Turbo Expo 2021 Submit your abstract by Wednesday, October 14 Submit Abstract â†’ The ASME Turbomachinery Technical Conference & Exposition 2021 (Turbo Expo) will be 100% virtual. Be sure to submit your abstract to our all-virtual ASME Turbo Expo 2021 event. You will be able to publish and present your work to the global turbomachinery community through an interactive and easy-to-use virtual event experience without any restrictions or cancellations. Abstract Submission Deadline - Wednesday, October 14 Reminder that all abstracts are due by 11:59 pm Eastern Time on Wednesday, October 14, 2020. Abstracts must be submitted online (plain text, 500-word limit) via the Turbo Expo website. If you have any questions, please contact igtiprogram@asme.org. subject: Nature's Best Engineering Animals
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Computer Simulation Reduce Design Cost of Medical Devices 10.08.2020 Video: Nature's Best Engineering Animals Animals like beavers, ants, and bees build some of the most impressive and efficient structures in nature. Using the tools provided to them in their surrounding environment, animals are capable of building homes that are as strong as ceramic or as detailed as a skyscraper. Sponsored Ad Bioengineering Blog: Four Ways Computational Modeling and Simulation Reduce Medical Device Design Costs Computational modeling and simulation is emerging as an effective approach in reducing development cost and time for bringing medical devices to market. The streamlined approach lowers barriers to develop innovative solutions and provides better treatment to patients. QUIZ: Subways and Mass Transit Advanced technology is making its mark on global rail and subway systems, and has since they were first built. Take this quiz to see what you know about urban mass transit. The world's first mass transit line was opened in 1863 and operated for 70 years before being incorporated into this city's transportation system? New York Berlin London Paris Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Design and Optimization of a BMR Loudspeaker Drive Unit October 15 | 2 pm ET Balanced mode radiator drive units are experiencing widespread adoption due to their full bandwidth, wide directivity radiation field that is largely decoupled from their physical size. Although the behavior of the diaphragm is unique, the remaining key elements of the drive unit, such as the motor and suspension structures, require similar optimization to conventional drive units. COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® will highlight some of the key design steps including the incorporation of the Magnetic Fields, Solid Mechanics, and Pressure Acoustics physics interfaces. subject: Soft Robotic Glove Provides Extra Strength
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter 9 Popular Design Software Programs 10.13.2020 9 Popular Engineering Software to Streamline Design Gaining hands-on experience with engineering software not only expands professional knowledge, but it also improves your chances of landing a job in the mechanical engineering field. Here are nine popular software packages for mechanical engineering and design. Sponsored Ad Soft Robotic Glove Boosts Workers' Grip Manufacturing workers are called daily to perform repetitive tasks that cause strain and fatigue over time. To combat that, Sweden's Bioservo has developed a soft robotic glove that reinforces the forearm's muscle strength, providing five times the strength of a 30-year-old man. Sponsored Ad Digital Twin First Manufacturing: Free Webinar On October 14th, ASME will host an IMTS Spark webinar featuring the 'founder of the digital twin' Dr. Michael Grieves and NASA Principal Technologist John Vickers, who discuss why a digital-twin first approach is critical to manufacturing success. Register for free today! Applications Abound for Tuneable 3D-Printed Polymer Researchers at Texas A&M University and the Army Research Laboratory have created a new 3D-printable polymer that can be tweaked to be harder or softer, depending on the application's demands. Those applications promise to be many, from artificial limbs to aerospace skins. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Design and Optimization of a BMR Loudspeaker Drive Unit October 15 | 2 PM ET Balanced mode radiator drive units are experiencing widespread adoption due to their full bandwidth, wide directivity radiation field that is primarily decoupled from their physical size. Although the diaphragm behavior is unique, the remaining key elements of the drive unit, such as the motor and suspension structures, require similar optimization to conventional drive units. COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® will highlight some of the key design steps, including incorporating the Magnetic Fields, Solid Mechanics, and Pressure Acoustics physics interfaces. L&D CORNER How to Get A Free eLearning Course from ASME Are you ready to take your engineering career to the next level? This October, we're offering one FREE eLearning course with any Virtual Classroom purchase. Sign up for ASME's B31 Piping Fabrication and Examination. This fundamental course trains participants to comply with the rules of the B31 Code sections (B31.1, B31.3, B31.5, and B31.9) when fabricating & examining piping. Registration ends October 20th! Offer ends October 31st, 2020. Multiple offers/discounts cannot be combined. The American Society of Mechanical Engineers Â® ( ASMEÂ® ) 101320 - 19007 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: Engineering A Reusable N95 Mask
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Test Your Knowledge on Small Nuclear Reactors 10.15.2020 Sponsored Content Video: 5 Smart Engineering Startups Small startup companies can be nimble enough to find clever solutions to vexing problems. Here we highlight five startups that have developed some innovative answers to everyday questions. Sponsored Ad Engineers Design a Reusable Alternative to N-95 Face Mask Resolving the N-95 mask shortage has been high-priority during the COVID-19 pandemic. A research team at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston has developed reusable masks that are just as efficient as the N-95 at filtering out droplets of water vapor carrying pathogens. Sponsored Ad Calling all AM Professionals We're looking for talented innovators to help us improve tomorrow's hydropower technology! The I AM Hydro Prize is open until Oct. 30, and competitors can win part of $250,000. Learn how you can use your expertise to solve challenges in hydropower. QUIZ: What Do You Know About Small Nuclear Reactors? A generation of new, small nuclear reactors is on the drawing board, and some of the first have even been deployed. Test your knowledge of small nuclear reactors with this quiz. According to the U.S. Department of Energy, small nuclear reactors have some marked advantages over conventional reactors. Which of the following is not considered an advantage? They use potassium fuel, rather than uranium They have small physical footprints They require less money to build They can be sited in places where large power plants can't fit Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Remote Threats: Insider Risk and the Remote Work Paradigm October 26 | 2 pm ET It's a new world for businesses everywhere. Learn the indicators professionals look for in potential problem employees and review the motivations that drive employees to cross the line. Get equipped with strategies and questions you should ask your leadership to better protect you company in these unprecedented times. L&D CORNER How to Get A Free eLearning Course from ASME Are you ready to take your engineering career to the next level? This October, we're offering one FREE eLearning course with any Virtual Classroom purchase. Sign up for ASME's Pipe Sizing, Pipe Wall Stresses, and Water Hammer. This course provides students with a thorough overview of pipe sizing, water hammer, unsteady flows, and, more importantly, the solutions to prevent or mitigate pipe wall stresses. Registration ends October 20th. Offer ends October 31st, 2020. Multiple offers/discounts cannot be combined. subject: Does STEM Diversity Promote Workforce Diversity?
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter ASME's Events to Engage with Industry 10.16.2020 Does STEM Diversity Promote Workforce Diversity? Recent diversity efforts have tried to attract young women and minorities into STEM programs in an attempt to create a more inclusive workforce. STEM programs through elementary schools, high school, and college seek to change long-standing diversity trends to make STEM studies and jobs more accessible. Sponsored Ad Engaging with Industry Among the ways ASME is proud to serve the engineering community is in our ability to bring together world-leading organizations, practitioners, and scholars, across a variety of industries and technologies. Learn how ASME's industry events are bringing people together and advancing engineering. Sponsored Ad ASMEÂ® IMECEÂ® 2020 is Going Virtual - Register Today ASMEÂ® IMECEÂ® is going virtual this year, taking place November 16-19. With a fresh approach to learning, networking and advancing the industry, this online experience sets the stage for meaningful connections and knowledge sharing, without leaving your desk. With up to 20 parallel sessions addressing every aspect of mechanical engineering, you will gain expertise, share insights and network with an expanded audience of researchers, academics and government experts from around the world. Register today for as low as $199! Schools Work to Build a Pathway to STEM STEM education, encompassing engineering and technology as well as science and math, has been a priority for more than a decade. Fast forward to 2020 and the question is: Has the new emphasis on STEM education changed anything? It depends who you ask. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Remote Threats: Insider Risk and the Remote Work Paradigm October 26 | 2 pm ET It's a new world for businesses everywhere. Learn the indicators professionals look for in potential problem employees and review the motivations that drive employees to cross the line. Get equipped with strategies and questions you should ask your leadership to better protect you company in these unprecedented times. L&D CORNER How to Get A Free eLearning Course from ASME Are you ready to take your engineering career to the next level? This October, we're offering one FREE eLearning course with any Virtual Classroom purchase. Sign up for ASME's B31.3 Process Piping Code. This introductory course trains participants on the requirements of the ASME B31.3 Code, including design, analysis, materials, fabrication, testing, and inspection of process piping systems. Registration ends November 3rd! Offer ends October 31st, 2020. Multiple offers/discounts cannot be combined. subject: Applications Now Available for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE Program
body: Applications Now Available for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE Program Applications are Now Available for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE Program Learn More â†’ ASME created the Early Career Leadership Intern Program to Serve Engineers (ECLIPSE) to give early career engineers an opportunity to further their professional and volunteer development. ECLIPSE interns are placed in highly visible and productive roles in a range of areas across the Society. The program enables interns to network and learn from industry leaders who volunteer throughout ASME. Interns also participate in leadership workshops and trainings. During the ECLIPSE program, interns are paired with volunteer coaches who help them navigate the Society and they are given exposure to the executive leadership of this international organization. This is a unique opportunity for early career engineers who would like to advance within their profession and within ASME. If you are interested in the ECLIPSE Intern Program, please visit here to learn more about this program and access the 2021-2022 intern application. All 2021-2022 ECLIPSE applications are due by 5:00 p.m. EST on Wednesday, January 6, 2021. Sent to you on behalf of the ECLIPSE Internship Committee The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® )101620 - 21684 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: Lockheed Martin's Digital Twin Journey
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Three Advances in Robotic Prosthetics 10.20.2020 Empathetic Robots The present, ongoing crisis of the coronavirus pandemic has produced a tremendous stress on almost everyone on the planet. Technologists see automation and robotics as a means to reduce these burdens. If machines are to co-exist with us, they need to understand" some basic social rules and be programmed in a way that takes human attributions into account. Sponsored Ad ASME TechCast: Lockheed Martin's Digital Twin Journey Noah Fehrenbacher

subject: Celebrate E4C's 10-Year Anniversary at Impact.Engineered 2020
body: ASME News E4C celebrates 10 years at Impact.Engineered, Dec. 3-4, 2020 Vol. 39 No. 19 / October 23, 2020 Celebrate E4C's 10-Year Anniversary at Impact.Engineered Over the past 10 years, Engineering for Change (E4C) has helped create a cleaner, healthier, safer, and more sustainable world. Join E4C to celebrate its 10th anniversary, at the Impact.Engineered free virtual event, December 3-4, 2020. Register now Sponsored Ad Yaskawa Releases HV600 Drives Specifically designed for building automation, HV600 variable frequency drives and packages are perfectly suited for applications ranging from simple fan control with integrated BAS communication to advanced bypass control or multiplex pump control. Learn More â†’ Learn Digital Twin Implementation Strategies at ASME's Upcoming Virtual Event The Digital Twin Summit, taking place virtually from anywhere on November 11-12, is just a few weeks away. Connect with industry experts as they share key insights on the latest digital twin technologies and provide you with the tools and knowledge you need to make smarter investments and gain a competitive edge. subject: Tubular Robot Maneuvers Through the Body
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter The New Industrial Data Economy 10.27.2020 Sponsored Content The Latest EU Efficiency Regulations and How We Got Here The efficiency of external power supplies (EPS) is a concern of power supply manufacturers and OEM's. Discover the new Ecodesign 2019/1782 standard's new efficiency limits including new mandatory labeling and documentation requirements. Sponsored Ad Tubular Robot Maneuvers Through the Body A team of scientists at the University of California San Diego has developed a tubular robot for medical applications. The soft-flexible robot looks like an inverted sock outfitted with a magnet that can snake through the body's complex areas. Sponsored Ad Calling all AM Professionals! Apply your advanced manufacturing expertise to solve some of hydropower's biggest challenges! The I AM Hydro Prize is open for applications, and competitors can win part of $250,000. Learn how you can use your expertise to solve challenges in hydropower. Manufacturing Blog: The New Industrial Data Economy Machinery and facilities are generating more data than ever before. Who controls that data will determine the winners and losers in the new data economy. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Modeling Stresses and Deformations in Vacuum Viewports December 3 | 2 PM ET Quantum computing is becoming mainstream. Several leading companies in chemistry, medicine, finance, and logistics are using quantum computing to solve complicated mathematical problems. Learn how IonQ utilizes COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® to explore the thermal stresses in a commercial optical viewport during bake-out and the effect of vacuum pressure on the viewport's optical properties. L&D CORNER Register for Detail Engineering of Piping Systems This introductory course trains participants to develop detailed engineering diagrams, plot plans, and arrangements for piping systems. Text: Tubular Robot Maneuvers Through the Body ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter The New Industrial Data Economy 10.27.2020 Sponsored Content The Latest EU Efficiency Regulations and How We Got Here The efficiency of external power supplies (EPS) is a concern of power supply manufacturers and OEM's. Discover the new Ecodesign 2019/1782 standard's new efficiency limits including new mandatory labeling and documentation requirements. Sponsored Ad Tubular Robot Maneuvers Through the Body A team of scientists at the University of California San Diego has developed a tubular robot for medical applications. The soft-flexible robot looks like an inverted sock outfitted with a magnet that can snake through the body's complex areas. Sponsored Ad Calling all AM Professionals! Apply your advanced manufacturing expertise to solve some of hydropower's biggest challenges! The I AM Hydro Prize is open for applications, and competitors can win part of $250,000. Learn how you can use your expertise to solve challenges in hydropower. Manufacturing Blog: The New Industrial Data Economy Machinery and facilities are generating more data than ever before. Who controls that data will determine the winners and losers in the new data economy. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Modeling Stresses and Deformations in Vacuum Viewports December 3 | 2 PM ET Quantum computing is becoming mainstream. Several leading companies in chemistry, medicine, finance, and logistics are using quantum computing to solve complicated mathematical problems. Learn how IonQ utilizes COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® to explore the thermal stresses in a commercial optical viewport during bake-out and the effect of vacuum pressure on the viewport's optical properties. L&D CORNER Register for Detail Engineering of Piping Systems This introductory course trains participants to develop detailed engineering diagrams, plot plans, and arrangements for piping systems. subject: CALL FOR PAPERS: Special Issue on Thermodynamics of Vehicle Systems
body: ASME Journal of Energy Resources Technology ASME's Guide for Journal Authors Submit Manuscript â†’ CALL FOR PAPERSASME Journal of Energy Resources TechnologySpecial Issue on Thermodynamics of Vehicle Systems The Special Issue of ASME Journal of Energy Resources Technology will focus on thermodynamic, energy, exergy, sustainability, thermoeconomic, enhanced assessments and optimizations of various vehicle systems including road, aerial, rail, and marine vehicles. The Special Issue welcomes submissions related to energy utilization, efficiency, energy conversion, environmental, and economic aspects of vehicle systems in terms of thermodynamics. Topic Areas Main topics of the Special Issue are as follows but not limited to: Thermodynamic analyses of automotive engines Thermodynamic analyses of aircraft propulsion systems Thermodynamic analyses of marine engines Thermodynamic analyses of electric vehicles Thermodynamic analyses of autonomous and unmanned vehicles Thermodynamic analyses of vehicle air conditioning systems Thermodynamic analyses of energy recovery systems in vehicles Thermodynamic analyses of energy storage systems in vehicles Publication Target Dates Paper submission deadline: May 30, 2021 Initial review completed: June 30, 2021 Special Issue publication date: December 15, 2021 Submission Instructions Papers should be submitted electronically to the journal at journaltool.asme.org. If you already have an account, log in as author and select Submit Paper at the bottom of the page. If you do not have an account, select Submissions and follow the steps. In either case, at the Paper Submittal page, select the ASME Journal of Energy Resources Technology and then in the Special Issue dropdown menu choose Thermodynamics of Vehicle Systems. Papers received after the deadline or papers not selected for inclusion in the Special Issue may be accepted for publication in a regular issue. Special Issue Editors Habib GÃ¼rbÃ¼z, Assoc. Prof. Dr., Suleyman Demirel University, Turkey, habibgurbuz@sdu.edu.tr Yasin SÃ¶hret, Assoc. subject: What is the Future of Supersonic Flight?
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Learn About the Tech Advances in Solar Power 10.29.2020 Video: Technology Advances Solar Power As the demand for cheaper and more sustainable energy grows, solar cell researchers are making technology breakthroughs that could lead to more efficient energy production. This video spotlights a few recent technology advances in solar power. Sponsored Ad Infographic: Looking for Capturable Carbon A recent analysis indicates that out of the more than 6,500 industrial and power plants in the United States, only 418 are capable of supplying carbon dioxide cheaply enough for carbon sequestration. Find out where they are in this ASME infographic. Sponsored Ad Attend ASME's Offshore Wind Digital Solutions Summit - November 5, 2020 | Virtual The ASME Offshore Wind Digital Solutions Summit is the only conference solely focused on digital transformation in the wind industry. Explore how artificial intelligence, big data, digital twins, machine learning, robotics, and drones can help bring down the costs of the production, installation, and maintenance of turbines â€“ ultimately improving productivity and safety. Join today's business leaders and tomorrow's innovators to shape a new clean energy future. Register Today! Quiz: What is the Future of Supersonic Flights? There have been no supersonic civilian aircraft in service since 2003. However, advancements in aircraft technology may make supersonic air transport viable again. Take this quiz to test your knowledge on supersonic flights and their future. In the 1960s, the British and French governments came together to build a supersonic liner, which began flying in 1969 and entered commercial service in 1976. It had a maximum speed over twice the speed of sound, at Mach 2.04, with seating for 92 to 128 passengers. What was this liner called? A. Tupolev TU-144 B. Concorde C. Atlantic D. X-59 Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Modeling Stresses and Deformations in Vacuum Viewports December 3 | 2 pm ET Quantum computing is becoming mainstream. Several leading companies in chemistry, medicine, finance, and logistics are using quantum computing to solve complicated mathematical problems. Learn how IonQ utilizes COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® to explore the thermal stresses in a commercial optical viewport during bake-out and the effect of vacuum pressure on the viewport's optical properties. subject: Spread the Word about ASME's Free Freshman/First Year Student Membership
body: ASME Membership Freshman/First Year Students Can Join ASME for Free Connect with us: Spread the Word! ASME Student Membership is Free for Freshman/First Year Students You are already enjoying your FREE ASME Student Membership Isn't it time you let your friends in on the secret? Thank you for joining ASME as a student member and taking advantage of our Freshman/First Year Free option! Now we need your help to be sure every other eligible student knows about this great opportunity! As a student member you are the perfect ambassador to communicate the value of ASME to your Freshman/First Year friends who have yet to join. Simply point them to our quick and easy online form and they can become a student member for absolutely no-cost in just minutes! http://go.asme.org/students or http://go.asme.org/join In addition to telling your peers about this opportunity in person, you can also share ASME's Freshman/First Year Free Student Membership offer on Facebook, LinkedIn, Google+ and Twitter - or by forwarding this email or posting the offer on your university intranet - or however you wish! ASME is committed to helping mechanical engineering students reach their full potential - and with the help of students like you - we can continue to grow our global community of professional engineers and students who are working together to address the world's concerns in meaningful ways. Please help us spread the word about ASME Freshman/First Year Free Student Membership â€” your friends will thank you for it. http://go.asme.org/students or http://go.asme.org/join Unbeatable Benefits! Like regular ASME student membership, Freshman/First Year Free Membership includes unlimited use of AccessEngineering, ASME's world-class online reference tool with over 800 engineering titles including the essential Marks' Standard Handbook for Mechanical Engineers; Perry's Chemical Engineers' Handbook; Standard Handbook for Civil Engineers; Standard Handbook for Electrical Engineers, just to name a few! body: Participate to win prizes Student Hackathon Competition November 14-15, 2020 Only $25 Register Now â†’ Supported by the Computers and Information in Engineering Division, the ASME TEC Sector and the Manufacturing Engineering Division, the Student Hackathon Competition is a unique virtual opportunity occurring just ahead of the virtual IMECE. Win Cash Prizes: Winners will be selected by a team of judges after presenting their solutions to the Hackathon problems. Visit the web site for all the information! subject: Leveraging Digital Twins for Robotic Installations
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Why Buy When You Can Rent Lab Equipment? 10.30.2020 Manufacturing Blog: Should Maintenance Professionals Be Afraid of AI and Automation? While maintenance engineers may fear the rise of AI and automation, the best maintenance strategy is when automation is used to help engineers complete their jobs. Companies are effectively blending human inventiveness with machine and computer efficiency. Sponsored Ad Robotics Blog: Digital Twins for Robot Installations The digital twin enables engineers to simulate real-world industrial ecosystems for monitoring and predictive analytics. The power of these simulations is now being used for faster and more efficient robotic installations. Sponsored Ad Deploying Effective AR/VR Applications: Free Webinar CTO/Founder of Tech3 Innovation will reveal proven applications to help manufacturers realize their potential leveraging digital twin. Tune in on November 4 to this free ASME-hosted IMTS Spark webinar. Register today! Lab Equipment: Why Buy When You Can Rent? Renting lab and test equipment may be a real cost saver for lab managers, engineering firms, or companies in the energy, medical, environmental, or myriad other sectors that rely on specialized equipment that can be expensive to buy outright. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Modeling Stresses and Deformations in Vacuum Viewports December 3 | 2 pm ET Quantum computing is becoming mainstream. Several leading companies in chemistry, medicine, finance, and logistics are using quantum computing to solve complicated mathematical problems. Learn how IonQ utilizes COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® to explore the thermal stresses in a commercial optical viewport during bake-out and the effect of vacuum pressure on the viewport's optical properties. L&D CORNER How to Get A Free eLearning Course from ASME Are you ready to take your engineering career to the next level? This October, we're offering one FREE eLearning course with any Virtual Classroom purchase. Sign up for ASME's B31.3 Process Piping Code. This introductory course trains participants on the requirements of the ASME B31.3 Code, including design, analysis, materials, fabrication, testing, and inspection of process piping systems. subject: Clean Combustion Engine that Traps Carbon Emissions
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Test Your Knowledge on the History of CAD 11.03.2020 The Promise of Design Evolution A leading philosopher of engineering explains how understanding why designs get stuck in a basic form can help engineers pursue fruitful avenues of design. Sponsored Ad Clean Combustion: Trapping Carbon Emissions Spanish researchers claim a new combustion engine eliminates tailpipe emissions, capturing carbon dioxide and eliminating nitrogen oxide. They are developing it to help meet upcoming strict European Union emission standards. Sponsored Ad Deploying Effective AR/VR Applications: Free Webinar CTO/Founder of Tech3 Innovation will reveal proven applications to help manufacturers realize their potential leveraging digital twin. Tune in on November 4 to this free ASME-hosted IMTS Spark webinar. Register Today! QUIZ: The History of Computer-Aided Design Computer-aided design can trace its origins back to the research conducted by several scientists and engineers in the late 1940s, working on numerical control of machine tools and engineering design. Today CAD is one of the primary design tools used by engineers around the world. Learn more about the history of CAD by taking the quiz below. Patrick Hanratty, Ph.D., was an American computer scientist and is considered the father of CAD and CAM. He designed Pronto

subject: Applications Are Being Accepted for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE Program
body: Apply Now for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE Program Apply Now for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE Program! Learn More â†’ Are you looking to advance your leadership skills and gain more experience as a volunteer with ASME? Then the ECLIPSE program is for you! We created the Early Career Leadership Intern Program to Serve Engineers (ECLIPSE) to give early career engineers an opportunity to further their professional and volunteer development. During the ECLIPSE program, interns are paired with volunteer coaches who help them navigate the Society and they are given exposure to the executive leadership of this international organization. ECLIPSE interns are placed in highly visible and productive roles in a range of areas across the Society. Interns have the chance to network and learn from the industry leaders who volunteer throughout ASME. Interns also participate in leadership workshops and trainings. This is a unique opportunity for early career engineers who would like to advance professionally and within ASME. If you are interested in the ECLIPSE Program, please visit here to learn more about this program and access the 2021-2022 intern application. All 2021-2022 ECLIPSE applications are due by 5:00 p.m. EST on Wednesday, January 6, 2021. Sent to you on behalf of the ECLIPSE Internship Committee The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® )110320 - 21686 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: AccessEngineering: Work Smart & Solve Problems Quicker
body: See What's New on AccessEngineering See What You Can Do with AccessEngineering AccessEngineering will substantially increase your productivity at work or in school. Learn more and take advantage of this FREE technical member benefit today! Enter AccessEngineering â†’ DataVis A web-based, interactive data visualization tool that instantly displays property data across a wide range of materials. This exciting new feature is a carefully curated dataset of 200 materials and 65 properties - including cost-providing users with enough data to understand fundamental material properties without overwhelming them. DataVis Tutorial Video - 6 min Engineers Take on the Big Data Challenge - ASME E-Festsâ„¢ article Premium Search AccessEngineering's search and browse capabilities make it incredibly easy for users to quickly find the information they need. The search and browse experience are built around our proprietary engineering taxonomies, which were developed in conjunction with premier taxonomy experts as well as subject matter experts spanning every engineering discipline. Calculator Tools These time-saving tools streamline common calculations and increase accuracy, otherwise performed by hand-by embedding the relevant formulas directly in Excel spreadsheet workbooks. Interactive Graphs and Downloadable Tables These exclusive digital features make it easier to use any analyzes key data. Personalized Tools Allows users to highlight, organize, annotate, and share key information. This would require a one-time registration and a separate sign-in. Got a few minutes? Take a Tour of AccessEngineering Do not have a few minutes? View a 2-Minute Key Features Presentation AccessEngineering delivers world-class, core engineering information right to your desktop! subject: A Robotic SlothBot Engineered to be Slow
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter 6 Safety Measures for Hydraulic Hose Assemblies 11.5.2020 Podcast: Preparing the Workforce for Digital Transformation In this episode of ASME TechCast, Vicki Holt, the CEO of Protolabs, provides insights into the digital trends shaping manufacturing and how companies can prepare the current and future workforce for this rapid transition accelerated by the pandemic. Sponsored Ad Georgia Tech's SlothBot is Engineered to be Slow The world wants fast robots. In the factory and in the air speed dominates. But just as slow animals have their niche, so do slow robots. GeorgiaTech's SlothBot is showing the world of robotics just how slow you can go. Sponsored Ad Robotics for Inspection & Maintenance Summit, Dec. 9-10 ASME's Robotics for Inspection & Maintenance Summit offers a unique combination of firsthand demonstrations, case studies, and expert discussions that will help businesses optimize inspection, maintenance, and repair while improving safety and lowering costs. This 2-day virtual summit is the only event solely dedicated to growing applications of robotic/drone and data analytic technologies that make performing asset inspections and maintenance work safer, faster, and with increased detection. Register Today! 6 Insurances for Safe Hydraulic Hose Assemblies Many hydraulic hose installations require additional safety to prevent catastrophic failures that can harm equipment and people. Although steel tubing is generally preferred for hydraulic lines, hoses are specified when fluid lines must be flexible to accommodate machine motion. Fortunately, many solutions are available to help prevent these types of failures. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Modeling Stresses and Deformations in Vacuum Viewports December 3 | 2 pm ET Quantum computing is becoming mainstream. Several leading companies in chemistry, medicine, finance, and logistics are using quantum computing to solve complicated mathematical problems. Learn how IonQ utilizes COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® to explore the thermal stresses in a commercial optical viewport during bake-out and the effect of vacuum pressure on the viewport's optical properties. L&D CORNER Register for ASME BPV Code, Section VIII, Division 1 Virtual Classroom Based on the rules for pressure vessel design and construction, this course is a comprehensive introduction to the requirements of ASME B&PVC, Section VIII, Division 1 and related standards for inspection, repairs, and alterations of pressure equipment. Sign up today - registration closes November 9th! Learn more about ASME Virtual Classroom here. The American Society of Mechanical Engineers Â® ( ASMEÂ® ) 110520 - 19061 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: ASME 2020 IMECE: Special Event Invitation - Manufacturing Policy Forum
body: Learning & Development An ASME Manufacturing Engineering Division (MED) Centennial Celebration Event Invitation: IMECE Special EventManufacturing Policy ForumMore Information â†’ ASME 2020 IMECE â€“ Manufacturing Policy Forum: SPECIAL EVENTâ€¦. An ASME Manufacturing Engineering Division (MED) Centennial Celebration EventDate: Wednesday, November 18, 2020Time: 6:00pm-8:00pm (Eastern Time)DescriptionThis forum is being hosted by the IMECE/Advanced Manufacturing Track and co-sponsored by Manufacturing Engineering Division (MED) and ASME Manufacturing Public Policy Task Force (MPPTF) to bring awareness of ASMEâ€™s role in U.S. Manufacturing Public Policy and the opportunities for ASME volunteers to make an impact. This panel will highlight ASME positions on various manufacturing public policy issues, and their importance to ASME members. Panelists will also share their experiences serving as Executive Branch and Congressional Fellows and how it impacted their careers and the Nation.Moderator:Tom Kurfess, ORNL â€“ Chief Mfg Officer; 2012 ASME Foundation Swanson Fellow at the Office of Science and Technology Policy (OSTP)Panelists:Asha Balakrishnan, Science and Technology Policy Institute (STPI), Research Staff Member; 2019-2020 ASME Congressional Fellow â€“ Subcommittee on Space & Aeronautics Committee on Science, Space, and TechnologyAndy Bicos, Boeing â€“ Retired; 2016-2017 ASME Congressional Fellow - Office of U.S. Congressman Tom ReedConnie Lausten, P.E., ASME Committee on Government Relations, Chair and 2000 ASME Congressional FellowMarc Santos: Isle Utilities; 2019 ASME Congressional Fellow â€“ Office of U.S. Senator Chris Coons ï»¿Steven Schmid, Manufacturing Public Policy Task Force (MPPTF), Chair; 2012 ASME Foundation Swanson Fellow â€“ Advanced Manufacturing National Program Office (AMNPO), NISTOrganizers:Shawn Moylan, NIST; 2017-2018 ASME Congressional Fellow â€“ Office of U.S. Senator Gary Peters Gloria Wiens, Manufacturing Engineering Division (MED) Centennial Planning Committee, Chair; 2012-2015 ASME Foundation Swanson Fellow â€“ Advanced Manufacturing National Program Office (AMNPO), NISTRegistrationREGISTER FOR COMMITTTEE MEETINGS & SPECIAL EVENTS: https://cong1120.registerat.com/Please note that this $0.00 registration does NOT give you access to the IMECE technical sessions, but you will have a limited access on Day 1 (November 16th) to listen to the opening keynote address and visit the virtual Exhibit Hall.ALL REGISTRANTS will receive an email with instructions on how to download the CrowdCompass Event App. This app can be downloaded onto your desktop or smart phone and will give you access to the special events. Emails will start to go out next week to all registrants.A CURRENT LIST OF MEETINGS & SPECIAL EVENTS CAN BE FOUND HERE: https://event.asme.org/IMECE/Program/Committee-Meetings-Special-Events Questions? Contact Barbara Zlatnik at ASME (zlatnikb@asme.org). This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: Interested in Learning More About ASME Standards Development?
body: ASME is hosting an introductory webinar to standards development. ASME STANDARDS & CERTIFICATION is hosting an introductory webinar and Q&A session for its newly appointed committee members and other interested parties on December 3, 2020 at 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM EDT. To register, please visit here. Register Now â†’ What you will learn: Committee structures and the processes ASME uses to develop standards An introduction to ASME's C&S Connect - the primary electronic tool used in the standards development process The benefits of volunteering on an ASME standards development committee What you will leave with: Valuable information and resources needed to participate effectively on ASME standards development committees. For more information, please contact Mr. Carlton Ramcharran (ramcharranc@asme.org, 1.212.591.7955). The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® )110520 - 21882 Â© 2020 The American Society of Mechanical Engineers. All rights reserved. subject: Student Hackathon Competition - time is running out!
body: Deadline to sign up is tomorrow Student Hackathon Competition November 14-15, 2020 Only $25 Register Now â†’ The Student Hackathon Competition is a unique virtual opportunity occurring just ahead of the virtual IMECE. The deadline to sign up is tomorrow, November 10, so don't delay! This student Hackathon is supported by the Computers and Information in Engineering Division, the ASME TEC Sector and the Manufacturing Engineering Division Why is the Essential for you to Attend? Important and Relevant Theme: Students will solve engineering problems addressing the theme, Identifying

subject: Advancing Additive Manufacturing in Aerospace
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Nuclear Test Reactor Built with Digital Engineering Tools 11.10.2020 Video: The Value of Robots Continues to Grow The International Federation of Robotics reports robots set a record with 2.7 million industrial robots working worldwide, an increase of 12 percent from 2018. The COVID-19 pandemic caused a decrease in overall sales. However, it also increased the use of service robots to help society during this time. Learn more about the IFR report in our latest video. Sponsored Ad Advancing Additive Manufacturing in Aerospace Porosity issues, fissures, and cracks during metal 3D printing can affect a part's structural integrity. The National Center for Additive Manufacturing Excellence at Auburn University improves the consistency and accuracy of metal 3D printing and advanced manufacturing for the aerospace industry. Sponsored Ad The Digital Twin Summit, Nov. 11-12 ASME's Digital Twin Summit is a 2-day virtual experience that enables you and your manufacturing organization to incorporate this technology and navigate all aspects of the digital lifecycle - data analytics, artificial intelligence, smart products, generative design, additive manufacturing, proactive quality control, intelligent systems, and cybersecurity - so you have the technical knowledge and tools you need to optimize your product design and manufacturing Register today for this week's event! Building the Versatile Test Reactor with Digital Engineering Tools Engineers at Idaho National Laboratory have adapted digital engineering technology to help build the Department of Energy's proposed Versatile Test Reactor (VTR). It is expected that developing VTR via digital engineering will significantly reduce risk by organizing all the project's data and models in a centralized, interactive system that guides the complex project from inception through design and construction and into operations. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Modeling Stresses and Deformations in Vacuum Viewports December 3 | 2 PM ET Quantum computing is becoming mainstream. Several leading companies in chemistry, medicine, finance, and logistics are using quantum computing to solve complicated mathematical problems. Learn how IonQ utilizes COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® to explore the thermal stresses in a commercial optical viewport during bake-out and the effect of vacuum pressure on the viewport's optical properties. L&D CORNER Register for the API 579-1/ASME FFS-1 Fitness-For-Service Evaluation Virtual Classroom starting December 7th This fundamental course trains participants to apply the requirements of API 579/ ASME FFS-1 to make run, repair, and replacement decisions for pressure vessels, piping, and tanks. Sign up today! Registration ends on November 30th. The American Society of Mechanical Engineers Â® ( ASMEÂ® ) 111020 - 19011 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: E-Fest Careers 2020 Draws Thousands
body: E-Fest Careers addresses how to succeed at pivoting in your career and staying focused on your goals and through the process November Issue 2020 E-Fest Virtual Career Day 2020 Draws Thousands The E-Fest Career event held on 11/7/20 included 36 expert speakers and offered multiple tracks enabling participants to customize their agenda and explore such professional areas as entrepreneurship, global opportunities and the hottest industries for engineering. The day also included special sections on career mapping as well as practical advice on interviews, crafting your best resume and job search strategies. Resources from the event will be available on-line on the E-Fest YouTube Channel. Learn More â†’ Sponsored Ad Applications Now Open for ECLIPSE 2021-2022 Program If you are an early career engineer interested in growing your leadership skills and expanding your involvement with ASME, then ECLIPSE is for you! The Early Career Leadership Intern Program to Serve Engineers (ECLIPSE) is a year-long program where participants are paired with volunteer mentors and exposed to the top leaders at ASME. Apply Now â†’ IGTI SAC Student Paper Review Initiative The SAC Student Paper Review Initiative aims to pair a student with a senior member of the community to complete a paper review. We are looking for students who are interested in reviewing a paper for Turbo Expo 2021 and the Journal of Turbomachinery. This is an excellent opportunity to learn how the review process works, and to work with a leader in the student's preferred field. Apply Now â†’ FutureME Stories - A Video Submissions Project for ASME Early Career Engineers The ASME FutureME Stories is designed to give engineers a chance to share their career experiences, learn from others, and be part of a community of engineers that want to be creative and showcase their enthusiasm for the profession and encourage other professionals! Learn More â†’ Sponsored Ad Webinar: A Day in the Life of an ME working at Shell Ever wondered what it's like to work as a mechanical engineer for one of the world's largest oil and gas company? Come join us for this exclusive webinar with Benjamin Salmon, a Staff Wells Mechanical Engineer for Shell Exploration and Production Company, supporting Deepwater Gulf of Mexico Operations, scheduled Wednesday, November 18, 1 PM EST. Register Now â†’ New Edition of Classic Project Management Book This fully revised and updated edition of International Project Management for Technical Professionals is an essential read for all project managers, whether your projects are local or globally based. This book cuts to the common core of all projects, effective communication. An enjoyable read and a great reference for how to build successful international business relationships now and in the future. Learn More â†’ How to stay connected to your network during a transition across continents? A brief FutureME Mini-Talks Q&A response on how to stay connected to a network when in transition. Watch Now â†’ Sponsored Ad Digital Engineering: The Manufacturing Tools of Tomorrow Processes such as computer-aided design, simulation, finite element analysis, digital assembly, additive manufacturing, and the digital twin have created a new cradle to grave design/manufacturing timeline for engineers. Join us for a four-part series to discuss how these new tools are changing and molding the next phase of design and manufacturing. Register Now â†’ AccessEngineering Remote Access NEW! ASME members can now log into AccessEngineering directly without having to come to the Accessengineering web page on ASME.org first. Click on Seamless Remote Access for details. Learn More â†’ Pivoting from Engineer to Lawyer A brief FutureME Mini-Talks Q&A response on why one of our presenters switched from engineering to being a lawyer. Watch Now â†’ ASME Scholarship Program The application process will open Early December 2020 for the 2021-22 academic school year. Learn more about the things you need to know before applying. Text: E-Fest Careers 2020 Draws Thousands E-Fest Careers addresses how to succeed at pivoting in your career and staying focused on your goals and through the process November Issue 2020 E-Fest Virtual Career Day 2020 Draws Thousands The E-Fest Career event held on 11/7/20 included 36 expert speakers and offered multiple tracks enabling participants to customize their agenda and explore such professional areas as entrepreneurship, global opportunities and the hottest industries for engineering. The day also included special sections on career mapping as well as practical advice on interviews, crafting your best resume and job search strategies. Resources from the event will be available on-line on the E-Fest YouTube Channel. Learn More â†’ Sponsored Ad Applications Now Open for ECLIPSE 2021-2022 Program If you are an early career engineer interested in growing your leadership skills and expanding your involvement with ASME, then ECLIPSE is for you! The Early Career Leadership Intern Program to Serve Engineers (ECLIPSE) is a year-long program where participants are paired with volunteer mentors and exposed to the top leaders at ASME. Apply Now â†’ IGTI SAC Student Paper Review Initiative The SAC Student Paper Review Initiative aims to pair a student with a senior member of the community to complete a paper review. We are looking for students who are interested in reviewing a paper for Turbo Expo 2021 and the Journal of Turbomachinery. This is an excellent opportunity to learn how the review process works, and to work with a leader in the student's preferred field. Apply Now â†’ FutureME Stories - A Video Submissions Project for ASME Early Career Engineers The ASME FutureME Stories is designed to give engineers a chance to share their career experiences, learn from others, and be part of a community of engineers that want to be creative and showcase their enthusiasm for the profession and encourage other professionals! Learn More â†’ Sponsored Ad Webinar: A Day in the Life of an ME working at Shell Ever wondered what it's like to work as a mechanical engineer for one of the world's largest oil and gas company? Come join us for this exclusive webinar with Benjamin Salmon, a Staff Wells Mechanical Engineer for Shell Exploration and Production Company, supporting Deepwater Gulf of Mexico Operations, scheduled Wednesday, November 18, 1 PM EST. Register Now â†’ New Edition of Classic Project Management Book This fully revised and updated edition of International Project Management for Technical Professionals is an essential read for all project managers, whether your projects are local or globally based. This book cuts to the common core of all projects, effective communication. An enjoyable read and a great reference for how to build successful international business relationships now and in the future. Learn More â†’ How to stay connected to your network during a transition across continents? A brief FutureME Mini-Talks Q&A response on how to stay connected to a network when in transition. Watch Now â†’ Sponsored Ad Digital Engineering: The Manufacturing Tools of Tomorrow Processes such as computer-aided design, simulation, finite element analysis, digital assembly, additive manufacturing, and the digital twin have created a new cradle to grave design/manufacturing timeline for engineers. Join us for a four-part series to discuss how these new tools are changing and molding the next phase of design and manufacturing. Register Now â†’ AccessEngineering Remote Access NEW! ASME members can now log into AccessEngineering directly without having to come to the Accessengineering web page on ASME.org first. Click on Seamless Remote Access for details. subject: What Do You Know of Solar Manufacturing?
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Starting a Career As a Medical Device Simulation Engineer 11.12.2020 Sponsored Content The Latest EU Efficiency Regulations and How We Got Here The efficiency of external power supplies (EPS) is a concern of power supply manufacturers and OEM's. Discover the new Ecodesign 2019/1782 standard's new efficiency limits including new mandatory labeling and documentation requirements. Sponsored Ad Bioengineering Blog: Preparing for a Career as a Simulation Engineer in Medical Devices For mechanical engineering students with an interest in medical device research and development, computational modeling and simulation can be a great option for a career path. But the design challenges requires familiarity with some areas that aren't always included in a typical engineering education. Sponsored Ad ASME IMECE 2020 is Going Virtual - Register Today ASME IMECE is going virtual this year, taking place November 16-19. With a fresh approach to learning, networking and advancing the industry, this online experience sets the stage for meaningful connections and knowledge sharing, without leaving your desk. With up to 20 parallel sessions addressing every aspect of mechanical engineering, you will gain expertise, share insights and network with an expanded audience of researchers, academics and government experts from around the world. Register today for as low as $199! QUIZ: What Do You Know About Solar Power Manufacturing? Photovoltaic cells used to be so expensive that solar power was only used in niche applications like pocket calculators and communications satellites. Today, solar is some of the cheapest power on the electric grid. Test your knowledge of this solar explosion. The French physicist Edmond Becquerel first observed the direct conversion of sunlight to electricity in 1839. What was his experiment? He noticed that particles of metal suspended in an acid solution followed a beam of light. He placed two silver-coated platinum electrodes in an acidic solution and exposed one of the electrodes to sunlight. He left a pure silicon ingot on a picnic table and found it developed an electric charge. He passed electricity through a germanium rod to make light; by reversing the process he made electricity. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Get the Design Knowledge You Need to 3D Print a Mold to Cast Silicone December 1 | 2 pm ET Casting silicone into a 3D printed mold is a cost effective and quick way to design flexible products in-house. However, many users feel that getting started with mold design for 3D printing can be a bit daunting. In this webinar you'll get a step-by-step tutorial for generating a mold around the CAD file of an existing part. L&D CORNER Register for the API 579-1/ASME FFS-1 Fitness-For-Service Evaluation Virtual Classroom starting December 7th This fundamental course trains participants to apply the requirements of API 579/ ASME FFS-1 to make run, repair, and replacement decisions for pressure vessels, piping, and tanks. Sign up today - registration ends November 30th. The American Society of Mechanical Engineers Â® ( ASMEÂ® ) 111220 - 19062 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. ABOUT US | CONTACT US | PRIVACY | UNSUBSCRIBE | MANAGE PREFERENCES Add @asme.org to your e-mail address book or safe senders to ensure delivery of ASME emails to your inbox. subject: How Happy Are Mechanical Engineers at Work?
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter The Expanding Role of Digital Engineering in Manufacturing 11.13.2020 Infographic: How Happy are Mechanical Engineers at Work? Mechanical engineers are not struggling to find work, but they also seem to be not very happy with their jobs and careers. A recent survey of mechanical engineers by recruiting firm Aerotek found large gaps in what they expect and what their managers provide. Sponsored Ad Finding Common Ground Across Generations Engineering workplaces were split between digitally native millennials and older employees more comfortable with face-to-face interactions. The COVID-19 pandemic forced everyone onto the same virtual page. Sponsored Ad Robotics for Inspection & Maintenance Summit, Dec. 9-10 ASME's Robotics for Inspection & Maintenance Summit offers a unique combination of firsthand demonstrations, case studies, and expert discussions that will help businesses optimize inspection, maintenance, and repair while improving safety and lowering costs. This 2-day virtual summit is the only event solely dedicated to growing applications of robotic/drone and data analytic technologies that make performing asset inspections and maintenance work safer, faster, and with increased detection. Register today! Podcast: The Expanding Role of Digital Engineering in Manufacturing Technology writer Jean Thilmany has followed software-enabled engineering for decades. In this episode of ASME TechCast, Thilmany talks with Jeffrey Winters, editor in chief of Mechanical Engineering magazine, about how digital engineering is expanding into the manufacturing sector. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Get the Design Knowledge You Need to 3D Print a Mold to Cast Silicone December 1 | 2 pm ET Casting silicone into a 3D printed mold is a cost-effective and quick way to design flexible products in-house. However, many users feel that getting started with mold design for 3D printing can be a bit daunting. In this webinar, you'll get a step-by-step tutorial for generating a mold around the CAD file of an existing part. L&D CORNER Register for the API 579-1/ASME FFS-1 Fitness-For-Service Evaluation Virtual Classroom starting December 7th This fundamental course trains participants to apply the requirements of API 579/ ASME FFS-1 to make a run, repair, and replacement decisions for pressure vessels, piping, and tanks. subject: ASME News Special Edition - Exploration into Technology Video Series Release
body: Vol. 39 No. 21 / November 16, 2020 Vol. 39 No. 21 / November 16, 2020 New ASME Video Series, Exploration into Technology, Now Available on YouTube 3D Printing, Robots, the Internet of Things and more With engineering technologies advancing at an unprecedented rate, we're excited to bring you the latest insights, innovations, and breaking news stories across the industry. Every week, Exploration into Technology episodes will explore a range of topics, from additive manufacturing to automation, AI, robotics, piping - as well as those connected to the ASME community. Enjoy a sneak peek of our latest episodes below. Subscribe to the ASME YouTube channel to keep up to date on the latest technology and how ASME is supporting its adoption and growth. In this episode, we break down how a Star Wars-inspired prosthetic is pushing robotics to new levels, what to expect of the growing AI market, and how innovations in new piping materials have created a shift in construction, manufacturing, and oil and gas industries. Also, learn how the pandemic has accelerated digital transformations across engineering organizations. Watch Now â†’ Explore how a team of engineers is taking a new approach to building a nuclear reactor, how the adaptation of new technologies to produce sustainable food for all creates both challenges and benefits, and how the implementation of digital twins continues to give organizations a competitive edge. Also, learn more about the Innovate for Impact Design Challenge, which awarded teams for global water and agriculture innovations. Watch Now â†’ The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® )111620 - 22217 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: Football Helmets to Protect Against COVID-19
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Test Your Knowledge on the Panama Canal 11.17.2020 6 Questions with Protolabs CEO Vicki Holt Industry 4.0 was already disrupting manufacturing, and the COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated the trend. The CEO of Protolabs, Vicki Holt, provides insights into the digital transformation of manufacturing and how companies can prepare for this rapid transition. Sponsored Ad A Football Helmet to Keep COVID-19 at Bay Iowa State engineers devised a new face shield for football helmets that protects against COVID-19. The design is available online and costs just 50 cents to make. Sponsored Ad Robotics for Inspection & Maintenance Summit, Dec. 9-10 ASME's Robotics for Inspection & Maintenance Summit offers a unique combination of firsthand demonstrations, case studies, and expert discussions that will help businesses optimize inspection, maintenance, and repair while improving safety and lowering costs. This 2-day virtual summit is the only event solely dedicated to growing applications of robotic/drone and data analytic technologies that make performing asset inspections and maintenance work safer, faster, and with increased detection. Register Today! QUIZ: What Do You Know About the Panama Canal? The Panama Canal has been called the world's greatest engineering project from the time it was completed in 1914. A $5.4-billion expansion large enough to fit the new post-Panamax ships was completed in 2016. Take this quiz to see what you know about the Panama Canal. American interest in building a canal across Central America began with what president? McKinley Van Buren Jefferson Grant Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Modeling Stresses and Deformations in Vacuum Viewports December 3 | 2 PM ET Quantum computing is becoming mainstream. Several leading companies in chemistry, medicine, finance, and logistics are using quantum computing to solve complicated mathematical problems. Learn how IonQ utilizes COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ® to explore the thermal stresses in a commercial optical viewport during bake-out and the effect of vacuum pressure on the viewport's optical properties. L&D CORNER Expansion Joints: How Thermal Expansion Solutions Can Become Big Pressure Problems Almost all industrial facilities - whether process, power, manufacturing, or research - have at least one and often many expansion joints to provide engineered solutions for issues such as thermal expansion, piping fit-up, equipment nozzle loads and vibration isolation. Sometimes they are the last resort. Other times, they are widely accepted as an extra means of safety. Grow your understanding of expansion joints with three key takeaways from this free whitepaper from ASME's expert instructor, Jim Meyer. The American Society of Mechanical Engineers Â® ( ASMEÂ® ) 111720 - 19012 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: What you need to know before applying for an ASME Scholarship
body: ASME Scholarships for the 2021-22 academic year Engineering Scholarships for the 2021-22 academic year Is the financial burden of paying for education stressing you out? Are you working several jobs to pay for classes? ASME is here to help! The ASME Scholarships focus on enabling a diverse cross-section of top humanitarian-involved students to become fully educated and equipped young mechanical engineers for the benefit of humankind. Learn More â†’ Take advantage of this opportunity - $400,000 in ASME Scholarships is available to support Mechanical Engineering student college education! What you should know before Applying? 80+ scholarships are available - for both undergraduate, and graduate students Scholarship funds are paid to the recipient's academic institution By completing a single online application, you shall be considered for all ASME Scholarships for which you may be eligible! ME/MET students enrolled full-time at an ABET accredited college or university during the 2021-2022 academic year. Students who demonstrate a high level of financial need - we want to help you graduate! Please Note: Pay close attention to the new tiered application deadlines for undergraduate and graduate applications. Learn More â†’ Application Opens November 25, 2020 The thought of delaying my senior year indefinitely until I could save up the money was heartbreaking. But thanks to the ASME Foundation Scholar Award

subject: The Mobile Wave of 5G is Coming
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter 7 Creative Appplications of Solar Energy 11.19.2020 Making a Greener Catalyst Researchers at the Nanomaterials Laboratory at Swansea University created The Matrix Assembly Cluster Source to reduce the environmental impact caused by the molecules used in pharmaceutical and other industries, which builds catalysts without producing toxic effluent. Sponsored Ad Infographic: The Mobile Wave of 5G 5G, the next generation of wireless networks, has arrived and will change how devices operate within infrastructure, industrial IoT, healthcare, and more. Learn more with our latest infographic on how 5G is being deployed across the globe and how the increase of 5G connected devices will impact industries. 7 Creative Applications of Solar Energy The demand for cheaper, more sustainable energy means solar energy companies will continue to find ways to improve solar cell technologies. New advances in solar energy technologies enable an increasing number of creative applications of solar energy. These include solar-powered roads, solar textiles, solar storage, floating solar farms, solar skins, noise barriers, and solar at night. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Get the Design Knowledge You Need to 3D Print a Mold to Cast Silicone December 1 | 2 pm ET Casting silicone into a 3D printed mold is a cost effective and quick way to design flexible products in-house. However, many users feel that getting started with mold design for 3D printing can be a bit daunting. In this webinar you'll get a step-by-step tutorial for generating a mold around the CAD file of an existing part. subject: ASME Convenes Public Policy Discussions at IMECE 2020
body: ASME News Discussions focused on priorities for the engineering community. Vol. 39 No. 22 / November 20, 2020 ASME Convenes Public Policy Discussions at IMECE 2020 In conjunction with the 2020 International Mechanical Engineering Congress and Exposition (IMECE), ASME convened engaging discussions focused on public policy priorities for the engineering community. Read more Sponsored Ad High Rotational Capacity Retaining Rings Self-locking rings are ideal for applications that have high rotational requirements. This feature allows the ring to function at speeds that exceed the recommended rotational capacity. Self-locking allows the ring to operate at high speeds, withstand vibration, and function under rapid acceleration. Learn More â†’ ASME Foundation's Philanthropic Impact Awards Two extraordinary women engineers received society-level awards at the recent ASME Foundation's Philanthropic Impact that two Society-level awards shining a spotlight on ASME's efforts to increase diversity across the engineering profession. Read more Sponsored Ad Get Access to Multiple Tracks on Robotics Solutions in Inspection & Maintenance Do not miss your chance to get exclusive access to various tracks focused on robotics solutions at ASME's Robotics for Inspection & Maintenance Summit. These tracks are broken down by robotic platform and operation to help you organize your agenda and connect with industry experts based on your business and engineering needs. If you are interested in watching sessions that are happening at the same time, don't worry! The sessions will be available on-demand the next day. If you have any questions or are interested in getting involved and collaborating with the team, email robotics@asme.org. View Tracks Sponsored Ad How to 3D Print a Mold to Cast Silicone Casting silicone into a 3D printed mold is a cost effective and quick way to design flexible products in-house. However, many users feel that getting started with mold design for 3D printing can be a bit daunting. Attend this webinar to get a step-by-step process for generating a mold around the CAD file of an existing part. Learn More Special Journal Issue on Autonomous Vehicle Technologies The ASCE-ASME Journal of Risk and Uncertainty in Engineering Systems, Part B: Mechanical Engineering is currently accepting manuscripts for a special issue focusing on the topic Autonomous Vehicle Technologies: Risk

subject: Are Service Bots the New Future?
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter It's Time to Embrace Cloud-Based Design and Engineering 12.01.2020 Sponsored Content Why It's Time to Embrace the Cloud in Design and Engineering There are growth opportunities all around us, especially those in cloud design. Today, there are opportunities to address emerging trends such as smart devices, increase efficiency and reduce costs, and ensure flexibility and agility in the supply chain - all with cloud-based engineering. Sponsored Ad Are Service Bots the New Future Post-COVID-19? The International Federation of Robotics released its World Robotics Service Robots 2020 report detailing professional and domestic service robots' rise. Service robots will see increased usage in the medical industry, hospitality service, and goods delivery. Here are five key trends that will shape the industry. Infographic: Six Technologies That May Reshape Medicine A report from McKinsey Global Institute has identified six innovations in what it called the visible pipeline" involving advanced bioengineering solutions that should provide material health gains in the next two decades. These innovations won't simply add years to the end of someone's life

subject: Apply Now for ASME's Early Career Leadership Development Program
body: Applications for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE program are still being accepted. Start your application today! Apply Now for the 2021-2022 ECLIPSE Program! Learn More â†’ Want to develop your leadership skills and gain more experience as a volunteer with ASME? The ECLIPSE program is for you - and there's still time to apply for the 2021-2022 program! Applications are due January 6, 2021. ASME created the Early Career Leadership Intern Program to Serve Engineers (ECLIPSE) to give early career engineers an opportunity to advance their professional and volunteer development. ECLIPSE interns are paired with volunteer coaches and are given exposure to the executive leadership of this international organization. ECLIPSE is a unique opportunity for early career engineers who want to grow professionally and within ASME. ECLIPSE interns are given highly visible and productive roles in a range of areas across the Society. They have the chance to network and learn from the industry leaders who volunteer throughout ASME, and to participate in leadership workshops and trainings. If you are interested in the ECLIPSE Program, please visit here to learn more about this program and access the 2021-2022 intern application. All 2021-2022 ECLIPSE applications are due by 5:00 p.m. EST on Wednesday, January 6, 2021. subject: The Twists and Turns of Flying Snakes
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter The Forefront of Electronics and Fluid Power 12.03.2020 ASME TechCast: NREL's Walt Musial Talks Offshore Wind The Department of Energy's National Renewable Energy Laboratory's new report shows offshore wind generation growing in the U.S. and globally. Turbines are getting larger and developers want to site them in ever deeper water. NREL's Walt Musial, principal engineer and offshore wind lead, talks about the offshore market and what can be expected in the coming year in this podcast. Sponsored Ad The Forefront of Electronics and Fluid Power Advances in hydraulics and pneumatics technologies have begun reshaping the face of fluid power. The integration of electronics has spearheaded much of this growth into components and systems. Why Flying Snakes Make Mid-Air Undulations Virginia Tech professor finds that flying snakes depend on midair undulations to fly between trees. Without those movements that keep them rotationally stable they would fall. Sponsored Ad WHITE PAPER The Ultimate Guide to Visual Project Planning Visual project planning is a powerful technique to help you avoid the many variables that might sink your project. Even better, it can help you identify and avoid potential problems before they occur. In this eBook, you'll get a complete roadmap for the tools and techniques you'll need to plan projects visually. L&D CORNER Expansion Joints: How thermal expansion solutions can become big pressure problems Almost all industrial facilities - whether process, power, manufacturing or research - have at least one and often many expansion joints to provide engineered solutions for issues such as thermal expansion, piping fit-up, equipment nozzle loads and vibration isolation. Sometimes they are a last resort. Other times, they are widely accepted as an extra means of safety. Grow your understanding of expansion joints with three key takeaways from this free whitepaper from ASME's expert instructor, Jim Meyer.
