subject: CALL FOR PAPERS: Special Issue on Probabilistic Approaches for Robust SHM of Wind Energy Infrastructure
body: ASCE-ASME Journal of Risk and Uncertainty in Eng. Systems ASME's Guide for Journal Authors Submit Manuscript â†’ CALL FOR PAPERSASCE-ASME Journal of Risk and Uncertainty in Engineering Systems, Part B: Mechanical EngineeringSpecial Issue on Probabilistic Approaches for Robust Structural Health Monitoring of Wind Energy Infrastructure (SI047B) Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) relies on the premise of collection of sensory information primarily pertaining to the structural response of engineered systems. For wind energy infrastructure, and wind turbine structures in particular, this information can in turn be exploited for early stage performance verification, for investigation of uncertainties related to the design and manufacturing process, for diagnostics and prognostics on degradation, damage and abnormal operation, as well as provide input for optimization of future designs. The types of information extracted from SHM systems deployed on wind turbines include measurements of the environmental inflow conditions, operational conditions, structural load effects, system dynamics, mode shapes, natural frequency and damping characteristics, stress hot-spots"
Text: CALL FOR PAPERS: Special Issue on Probabilistic Approaches for Robust SHM of Wind Energy Infrastructure ASCE-ASME Journal of Risk and Uncertainty in Eng. Systems ASME's Guide for Journal Authors Submit Manuscript â†’ CALL FOR PAPERSASCE-ASME Journal of Risk and Uncertainty in Engineering Systems, Part B: Mechanical EngineeringSpecial Issue on Probabilistic Approaches for Robust Structural Health Monitoring of Wind Energy Infrastructure (SI047B) Structural Health Monitoring (SHM) relies on the premise of collection of sensory information primarily pertaining to the structural response of engineered systems. For wind energy infrastructure, and wind turbine structures in particular, this information can in turn be exploited for early stage performance verification, for investigation of uncertainties related to the design and manufacturing process, for diagnostics and prognostics on degradation, damage and abnormal operation, as well as provide input for optimization of future designs. The types of information extracted from SHM systems deployed on wind turbines include measurements of the environmental inflow conditions, operational conditions, structural load effects, system dynamics, mode shapes, natural frequency and damping characteristics, stress hot-spots"

subject: Test Your Knowledge of the 3D Printing Industry
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter 5 Ways to Make Roads More Sustainable 12.08.2020 Manufacturing Blog: Innovating with the Government Contractors want to retain as much intellectual property as they can when they work on cutting-edge government projects. Often, IP rights may need to be determined via litigation. Sponsored Ad 5 Ways to Make Roads More Sustainable The basic method of building roads has not changed much since the Romans used stone, aggregate and cement. Renewable materials embedded with smart technology will bring roadbuilding to a new standard. QUIZ: How Well Do You Know the 3D Printing Industry? 3D printing can be found in today's automotive industry, the medical sector, the military industry, and even food manufacturing. Take our quiz and see how much you know about the 3D printing market. In 2020, the worldwide market for 3D printing products and services was projected to reach 16 billion U.S. dollars. According to Wohlers Associates, what is the projected market size for 2024? 40.8 billion 20.6 billion 35.1 billion 25.5. billion Sponsored Ad WHITE PAPER Digital Twins for Predictive Maintenance Digital twins can be used to evaluate the current condition of an asset, and more importantly, predict future behavior, refine the control, or optimize operation. Read this ebook to learn the basics of digital twins, including common applications and benefits, primary modeling methods, and how to create a digital twin for predictive maintenance. L&D CORNER Fracture Mechanics Virtual Classroom starts January 25th Providing a practical understanding of fatigue and fracture calculations, this course is intended for engineers who are required to perform such calculations, or who specify or evaluate testing and draft fatigue or fracture portions of design requirements. Registration ends January 19th with only 30 seats available, so register today. Take our quiz and see how much you know about the 3D printing market. In 2020, the worldwide market for 3D printing products and services was projected to reach 16 billion U.S. dollars. According to Wohlers Associates, what is the projected market size for 2024? 40.8 billion 20.6 billion 35.1 billion 25.5. billion Sponsored Ad WHITE PAPER Digital Twins for Predictive Maintenance Digital twins can be used to evaluate the current condition of an asset, and more importantly, predict future behavior, refine the control, or optimize operation. Read this ebook to learn the basics of digital twins, including common applications and benefits, primary modeling methods, and how to create a digital twin for predictive maintenance. L&D CORNER Fracture Mechanics Virtual Classroom starts January 25th Providing a practical understanding of fatigue and fracture calculations, this course is intended for engineers who are required to perform such calculations, or who specify or evaluate testing and draft fatigue or fracture portions of design requirements. Registration ends January 19th with only 30 seats available, so register today. subject: Emerging Tech Award Winners Battle COVID-19
body: ME Magazine Emerging Technology Awards Engineers helping fight COVID-19 through innovation. TechReboot Special Edition:Emerging Tech Awards The Emerging Technology Awards usually recognize innovations in five engineering fields, but this year the editors at Mechanical Engineering magazine realized the technologies that made the most difference this year were the ones taking aim at COVID-19. Engineers everywhere have applied their heads and their hearts to meet real human needs this year. We celebrate these technologies and the innovators behind them with the Emerging Technology Awards. Engineers in Action During COVID-19 ASME's CEO Thomas Costabile congratulates the innovators spotlighted in the Mechanical Engineering magazine Emerging Technology Awards and honors innovations that put the pandemic in the crosshairs. Read Now â†’ Video: 2020 Emerging Technology Awards In this year of improvisation on the fly, watch a video highlighting the 2020 Mechanical Engineering magazine Emerging Technology Awards and how engineers used the power of invention to battle the coronavirus. Watch Now â†’ UVD Robots and the Power of Light to Fight Bacteria Award Winner UVD Robots operate autonomously, navigating hospital corridors and rooms to disinfect and kill potentially life-threatening bacteria. When the COVID-19 crisis hit, these robots became an essential service in the fight against the coronavirus. Read Now â†’ Advanced Kiosks: Guarding the Gate Without Risking Infection The awards celebrate Advanced Kiosk's Guardian system, which checks vital signs to ensure only healthy people can enter a building. The automated system is faster and safer than using people to do checks. Read Now â†’ Medistar Corp's HVAC Virus Killer Medistar Corp. and researchers at the University of Houston and Texas A&M University created a heated HVAC filter made of nickel foam that traps and kills 99.8 percent of the COVID-19 virus. Read Now â†’ Starship Technologies: Using Robots to Deliver the Goods Award winner Starship Technologies' automated self-driving vehicles are delivery robots that can bring food to the hungry without risking disease transmission. Read Now â†’ Prusa Research 3D Printing for Protection Prusa Research won its award due to its fully open-source design for a face shield that can be quickly 3D printed. The design inspired makers to produce PPE for healthcare workers around the globe. Read Now â†’ ASME TechCast: Emerging Technologies to Fight COVID-19 The editors of Mechanical Engineering magazine tried something different this year with the annual Emerging Technology Awards. Listen as editor in chief Jeffrey Winters talks with editors John Kosowatz and Carlos GonzÃ¡lez about five innovations that are taking on COVID-19. Listen Now â†’ The American Society of Mechanical Engineers Â® ASMEÂ® 121010 - 19066 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: Training the Next Generation of Engineers
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter How Much of a Digital Engineer Are You? 12.11.2020 Workforce Blog: Working Against the Coronavirus In the face of a global calamity, engineers remain ceaselessly at work creating a better world. While the ultimate solution for COVID-19 will come in the form of a vaccine, engineers are devising technologies to limit the spread of the virus, either by killing it in the environment or reducing the points of contact between people. Sponsored Ad Training the Next Generation of Engineers Learning factories provide hands-on training opportunities for both students and manufacturing workers. They learn about integrating machine learning, cloud computing, the Internet of Things (IoT), embedded software systems, and other next-generation technologies of the factory floor - methods that underlie Industry 4.0. Sponsored Ad Virtually Disrupt Health Care This paper describes how 85% of the top 50 health care companies like Medtronic use Ansys simulations to optimize product and process development. Learn how coupling Ansys simulations with almost limitless compute power can improve the performance of medical devices, drugs and therapies in a low-risk, time- and cost-effective virtual environment. Learn more by visiting Ansys today! The Path to Professional Licensure The engineering profession is made up of highly educated people whose careers are devoted to protecting the world's health, safety, and welfare. One of the clearest ways a practitioner can demonstrate commitment to these values is through formal licensure. Having professional licensure can give you a leg-up in your engineering career. QUIZ: How Much of a Digital Engineer Are You? Engineers today are already heavily invested in digital tools and technology. According to an ASME study on digital adoption, 80 percent are significantly using digital tools in their everyday work routines. Since digital tools and technology cross disciplines and industries, anyone can be a digital engineer. So, where do you fall on the digital engineering spectrum? What activity do you prefer? Assembling a LEGO kit Immersive virtual reality headset Flying a remote control drone Sponsored Ad WHITE PAPER The Ultimate Guide to Visual Project Planning Visual project planning is a powerful technique to help you avoid the many variables that might sink your project. Even better, it can help you identify and avoid potential problems before they occur. In this eBook, you'll get a complete roadmap for the tools and techniques you'll need to plan projects visually. L&D CORNER Fracture Mechanics Virtual Classroom starts January 25th Providing a practical understanding of fatigue and fracture calculations, this course is intended for engineers who are required to perform such calculations, or who specify or evaluate testing and draft fatigue or fracture portions of design requirements. Registration ends January 19th with only 30 seats available, so register today. subject: Walking Place with Virtual Reality Boots
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Learn how to design the optimal CAD workstation. 12.15.2020 Hydrogen Evolution or Revolution? Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe. Engineers are working to overcome the challenges to producing hydrogen fuel at scale and adapting gas turbines to burn it. Sponsored Ad Walking in Place with VR Boots EKTO VR is developing robotic boots for VR users that keep them in one place while walking. The concept is similar to a treadmill: as a person walks forward, the boots slide back keeping him or her from advancing. Sponsored Ad Yaskawa Moves You Forward in 3D Move your additive applications forward with Yaskawa! Our Sigma-7 servos provide smooth, precise motion for 3D printing. Couple our G-code-compatible MP3300iec controller with Yaskawa Compassâ„¢, our customizable user interface, to bring precision, performance, and creativity to your application. Visit Yaskawa to learn more! The Buzz about Cicada Wings An interdisciplinary team of engineers, chemists, and biologists have devised a clever and low-tech method to reproduce nanostructures in those cicada wings that are key to repelling water and bacteria. The research may help in developing water-resistant or water-proof materials. Sponsored Content QUIZ: How to Optimize Your Workstation for CAD and Simulation Learn a few of the essential design tips via our quiz on the best hardware choices for your personal workstation and how it can be optimized for CAD design, rendering, and simulation. Selecting the number of processing cores in your workstation is critical. Design software, such as SOLIDWORKS, is a frequency bound applicationâ€”meaning that it predominantly uses only one core. And you could run your machine with only two cores if you were running nothing elseâ€”not even an operating system. However, many engineers are running multiple programs simultaneously, such as part libraries, data management software, email clients, etc. How many cores are ideal for a typical multitasking CAD user? 2 to 3 4 to 5 5 to 6 6 to 8 Sponsored Ad WHITE PAPER How to Configure the Ultimate SOLIDWORKS Workstation Packed with vital details and expert insight you won't find anywhere else, the exclusive new guide will enable you to configure a system purpose-built for your specific SOLIDWORKS workflow. Optimize performance, increase productivity, and experience real ROI when you're equipped with the facts. L&D CORNER Fracture Mechanics Virtual Classroom starts January 25th Providing a practical understanding of fatigue and fracture calculations, this course is intended for engineers who are required to perform such calculations, or who specify or evaluate testing and draft fatigue or fracture portions of design requirements. Registration ends January 19th with only 30 seats available, so register today. subject: Tech-Savvy Holiday Gift Guide
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Innovations in Vertical Farming 12.17.2020 Why It's Time to Embrace the Cloud in Design and Engineering There are growth opportunities all around us, especially those in cloud design. Today, there are opportunities to address emerging trends such as smart devices, increase efficiency and reduce costs, and ensure flexibility and agility in the supply chain - all with cloud-based engineering. Sponsored Ad Vertical Farms Are Growing Up After nearly a decade of research and development, Living Greens Farm and the company's vertical plane design are poised to take advantage of advances in automation to help feed a growing population that wants more organic products despite decreased land availability. Sponsored Ad Small Wave Springs, Big Impact What will you do with a more compact design? In applications with tight space constraints, Crest-to-CrestÂ® wave springs are an engineer's choice for optimizing space, offering the same spring force as a traditional coil spring, but at a reduced height. Springs as small as 0.118 in. (3 mm). Visit Smalley to learn more! Work from Home Tech-Savvy Holiday Gifts The COVID-19 pandemic has forced engineering firms to limit their offices to necessary personnel only and reduce the number of workers per shift to limit interaction. Many engineers are working from home for the foreseeable future. Here are some holiday gift items to make the work from home space a little more productive. Sponsored Content QUIZ: The Evolution of Calcium Silicate Insulation with a Corrosion Inhibitor Johns Manville's Thermo-1200Â® Calcium Silicate uses the XOX Corrosion InhibitorÂ®, which helps protect against corrosion under insulation (CUI) and makes Thermo-1200 one of the least corrosive high-temperature insulations available. Test your knowledge on how insulation and corrosion inhibitors help protect against corrosive temperatures. Insulation materials with the XOX Corrosion InhibitorÂ® were shown to decrease the proliferation of corrosion on metal surfaces by depositing a layer of protective silicates and ions onto the metal surface after water enters the system. subject: CALL FOR PAPERS: Special Issue on AI and Engineering Design
body: Journal of Mechanical Design ASME's Guide for Journal AuthorsView Journal Video Submit Manuscript â†’ CALL FOR PAPERSASME Journal of Mechanical DesignSpecial Issue on Artificial Intelligence and Engineering Design Artificial Intelligence (AI) has advanced tremendously and has the potential to intersect the engineering design process in a variety of ways. For instance, designers could use AI to support more automatic and intelligent knowledge extraction and knowledge representation, to support early design ideation -- making the creation of products with enhanced multifunctionality possible, or even to discover design solutions to previously unrealized functions. Additionally, AI methods have great potential to solve problems where human intuition or human processing capabilities are insufficient, making it possible to expand the richness of design spaces that can be navigated effectively through AI support. Further, used as an identification tool, AI could enable more efficient and higher-performance design solutions during design revision at the manufacturing and assembly level by screening and identifying part consolidation design and multifunctional design potentials. An inverse perspective is also possible, where results from engineering design research, such as design automation methods, could be used to rapidly generate rich and tailored data sets that amplify the impact of AI methods. Furthermore, engineering design challenges and knowledge from design research could help inform new advancements in AI. Topic AreasThe following is a non-comprehensive list of representative topics within scope of this Special Issue: Descriptive knowledge extraction, representation and reasoning techniques for design using AI Early-stage design concept generation and exploration enabled by AI methods Designer-AI interaction (e.g., cognitive assistants for design) Applications of natural language processing to engineering design Capitalizing on product/system lifecycle datasets using AI AI-enabled material, metamaterial, and material system modeling and design Characterization and exploration of AI-systems robustness-performance tradeoffs Design methods for AI-enabled autonomous engineering systems (e.g., phones and autonomous vehicles) AI applied to Internet-of-Things (IoT) and cyber systems design and decision-making Survey, review, and assessment of challenges and opportunities at the interface of AI and engineering design AI-assisted design of mechanisms and other mechanical systems Education of AI for engineering design Publication Target Dates Paper submission deadline: April 1, 2021 Initial review completed: June 15, 2021 Final decision: September 1, 2021 Special Issue publication date: December, 2021 Submission Instructions Papers should be submitted electronically to the journal at journaltool.asme.org. If you already have an account, log in as author and select Submit Paper at the bottom of the page. If you do not have an account, select Submissions and follow the steps. In either case, at the Paper Submittal page, select the ASME Journal of Mechanical Design and then select the Special Issue Artificial Intelligence and Engineering Design. Papers received after April 1, 2021 may still be considered for the Special Issue, if time and space permits. Guest Editors James Allison, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, USA, jtalliso@illinois.edu Yaoyao Fiona Zhao, McGill University, Canada, yaoyao.zhao@mcgill.ca Christopher McComb, Pennsylvania State University, USA, uum209@psu.edu Michel-Alexandre Cardin, Imperial College London, UK, m.cardin@imperial.ac.uk Paul Witherell, National Institute of Standards and Technology, USA, paul.witherell@nist.gov Yi Ren, Arizona State University, USA, yiren@asu.edu Daniel Selva, Texas A&M University, USA, dselva@tamu.edu Conrad Tucker, Carnegie Mellon University, USA, conradt@andrew.cmu.edu The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® ) 121720 - 22355 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. Text: CALL FOR PAPERS: Special Issue on AI and Engineering Design Journal of Mechanical Design ASME's Guide for Journal AuthorsView Journal Video Submit Manuscript â†’ CALL FOR PAPERSASME Journal of Mechanical DesignSpecial Issue on Artificial Intelligence and Engineering Design Artificial Intelligence (AI) has advanced tremendously and has the potential to intersect the engineering design process in a variety of ways. For instance, designers could use AI to support more automatic and intelligent knowledge extraction and knowledge representation, to support early design ideation -- making the creation of products with enhanced multifunctionality possible, or even to discover design solutions to previously unrealized functions. Additionally, AI methods have great potential to solve problems where human intuition or human processing capabilities are insufficient, making it possible to expand the richness of design spaces that can be navigated effectively through AI support. Further, used as an identification tool, AI could enable more efficient and higher-performance design solutions during design revision at the manufacturing and assembly level by screening and identifying part consolidation design and multifunctional design potentials. An inverse perspective is also possible, where results from engineering design research, such as design automation methods, could be used to rapidly generate rich and tailored data sets that amplify the impact of AI methods. Furthermore, engineering design challenges and knowledge from design research could help inform new advancements in AI. Topic AreasThe following is a non-comprehensive list of representative topics within scope of this Special Issue: Descriptive knowledge extraction, representation and reasoning techniques for design using AI Early-stage design concept generation and exploration enabled by AI methods Designer-AI interaction (e.g., cognitive assistants for design) Applications of natural language processing to engineering design Capitalizing on product/system lifecycle datasets using AI AI-enabled material, metamaterial, and material system modeling and design Characterization and exploration of AI-systems robustness-performance tradeoffs Design methods for AI-enabled autonomous engineering systems (e.g., phones and autonomous vehicles) AI applied to Internet-of-Things (IoT) and cyber systems design and decision-making Survey, review, and assessment of challenges and opportunities at the interface of AI and engineering design AI-assisted design of mechanisms and other mechanical systems Education of AI for engineering design Publication Target Dates Paper submission deadline: April 1, 2021 Initial review completed: June 15, 2021 Final decision: September 1, 2021 Special Issue publication date: December, 2021 Submission Instructions Papers should be submitted electronically to the journal at journaltool.asme.org. If you already have an account, log in as author and select Submit Paper at the bottom of the page. If you do not have an account, select Submissions and follow the steps. In either case, at the Paper Submittal page, select the ASME Journal of Mechanical Design and then select the Special Issue Artificial Intelligence and Engineering Design. Papers received after April 1, 2021 may still be considered for the Special Issue, if time and space permits. Guest Editors James Allison, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, USA, jtalliso@illinois.edu Yaoyao Fiona Zhao, McGill University, Canada, yaoyao.zhao@mcgill.ca Christopher McComb, Pennsylvania State University, USA, uum209@psu.edu Michel-Alexandre Cardin, Imperial College London, UK, m.cardin@imperial.ac.uk Paul Witherell, National Institute of Standards and Technology, USA, paul.witherell@nist.gov Yi Ren, Arizona State University, USA, yiren@asu.edu Daniel Selva, Texas A&M University, USA, dselva@tamu.edu Conrad Tucker, Carnegie Mellon University, USA, conradt@andrew.cmu.edu The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® ) 121720 - 22355 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: ASME.org's Top Content of 2020
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Revisit the top articles, infographics, podcasts, and videos of 2020. 12.22.2020 Top 10 Engineering Stories of 2020 Despite the challenges unleashed by the pandemic, the scientific world has seen tremendous progress. Engineers, scientists, researchers, and the medical community have come together to find solutions to fight the coronavirus. These exemplary feats of ingenuity and improvisation-on-the-fly topped our list of engineering stories this year. Sponsored Ad Top 5 Infographics of 2020 The infographics that topped our 'Best Of' list covered engineering career insights, additive manufacturing, how ventilators work, engineers' satisfaction, nuclear energy, the future of 5G, and even science fiction. Check out the editors' pick for the top five infographics of 2020! Top 5 Videos of 2020 In spite of, or because of COVID-19, engineers kept working to better society throughout 2020. These top five videos highlight some of the people and their work, including emergency ventilator design, innovative university engineering programs, and engineering startups beginning life in the throes of the pandemic. Top 5 ASME TechCast Episodes of 2020 The ASME TechCast podcast series brought the voices of engineering innovators to its listeners all throughout 2020. From COVID-19 stories to manufacturing beyond China's borders, we highlight our top five of the year. If you missed one of these episodes, now is a great time to catch up. Sponsored Ad WHITE PAPER A Spotlight On the Birthplace of Industry: COVID-19 Disruption In Germany COVID-19 disruption remains a constant conversation, but the truth is that not all in the manufacturing industry are suffering. Leading digital manufacturing simulation software provider, aPriori, teamed up with a well-known manufacturing industry publication to conduct a readership survey on the effects of the COVID-19 crisis in the industrial engineering sector. Learn how the COVID-19 crisis has affected business, from its impact on industry production and output, to how workplaces are re-structuring to cope with the new normal. L&D CORNER Fracture Mechanics Virtual Classroom starts January 25th Providing a practical understanding of fatigue and fracture calculations, this course is intended for engineers who are required to perform such calculations, or who specify or evaluate testing and draft fatigue or fracture portions of design requirements. Registration ends January 19th with only 30 seats available, so register today. subject: Display Your Engineering Pride with a Framed ASME Membership Certificate
body: Let others know you are a Proud Member of ASME An ASME Membership Certificate will acknowledge your professional status and display your pride! By joining ASME, you have demonstrated your commitment to high professional standards. Let others know you are a member of the most respected professional mechanical engineering organization in the world by displaying an attractive, framed ASME Membership Certificate in your office or home. Every certificate is superbly printed on 8.5x11 quality grade paper with an embossed gold ASME seal. Your certificate will bear your name

subject: What is the Future of Digital Twins?
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Learn More About the Pitney Bowes Model M Postage Meter 01.05.2021 Crawling Around Designed to inspect hard-to-access wind turbine blades, a six-legged crawler bot called BladeBug has the potential to work in all kinds of weather. Instead of hanging from ropes to inspect a blade, technicians can work remotely with the bot to search for erosion and other issues. Sponsored Ad Video: Highlights from the Digital Twin Summit ASME's Digital Twin Summit brought together experts from the fields of aerospace, medicine, manufacturing, energy, and much more to discuss the latest advancements of the digital landscape. Watch a few of the speaker highlights from the summit to find out what the future of the digital twin has to offer. QUIZ: What Do You Know About the Pitney Bowes Model M Postage Meter? The first commercially successful postage meter revolutionized mail rooms everywhere. Test your knowledge of this ASME engineering landmark. Mechanical stamping machines were invented in the decades around 1900, but many suffered from a serious defect. What did they get wrong? They were opposed by post offices, which wanted to retain their monopoly. They had no foolproof means to stop theft. They required postal inspectors to regularly dismantle them to get data. The punctured the enveloped and often damaged letters. subject: AI Advances in the Automotive Industry
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Clean Energy Infrastructure for Rural Areas 01.07.2021 ASME TechCast: AI Advances in Automotive What role do mechanical engineers play in the intersection of AI and autonomy, and what are the opportunities for them? What skills will become increasingly valued in automotive companies with the advancement of AI? Dragos Maciuca, executive technical director at Ford's Research and Innovation Center, answers these questions and more in this episode of ASME TechCast. Sponsored Ad Energy Blog: Clean Energy Infrastructure Can Be a Win for Rural Areas A plan of action against climate change can bridge the rural-urban divide by bringing opportunities to places eager for jobs and economic growth while helping the nation meet decarbonization targets. Sponsored Content QUIZ: How to Optimize Your Workstation for CAD and Simulation Learn a few of the essential design tips via our quiz on the best hardware choices for your personal workstation and how it can be optimized for CAD design, rendering, and simulation. Selecting the number of processing cores in your workstation is critical. Design software, such as SOLIDWORKS, is a frequency bound applicationâ€”meaning that it predominantly uses only one core. And you could run your machine with only two cores if you were running nothing elseâ€”not even an operating system. However, many engineers are running multiple programs simultaneously, such as part libraries, data management software, email clients, etc. How many cores are ideal for a typical multitasking CAD user? 2 to 3 4 to 5 5 to 6 6 to 8 Sponsored Ad WHITE PAPER How to Configure the Ultimate SOLIDWORKS Workstation Packed with vital details and expert insight you won't find anywhere else, the exclusive new guide will enable you to configure a system purpose-built for your specific SOLIDWORKS workflow. Optimize performance, increase productivity, and experience real ROI when you're equipped with the facts. L&D CORNER Fracture Mechanics Virtual Classroom starts January 25th Providing a practical understanding of fatigue and fracture calculations, this course is intended for engineers who are required to perform such calculations or who specify or evaluate testing and draft fatigue or fracture portions of design requirements. Registration ends January 19th with only 30 seats available, so register today. Text: Testing the Power of Exoskeletons ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Protection Against High Temperatures with Corrosion and Insulation 01.05.2021 Crawling Around Designed to inspect hard-to-access wind turbine blades, a six-legged crawler bot called BladeBug has the potential to work in all kinds of weather. Instead of hanging from ropes to inspect a blade, technicians can work remotely with the bot to search for erosion and other issues. Sponsored Ad Video: Highlights from the Digital Twin Summit ASME's Digital Twin Summit brought together experts from the fields of aerospace, medicine, manufacturing, energy, and much more to discuss the latest advancements of the digital landscape. Watch a few of the speaker highlights from the summit to find out what the future of the digital twin has to offer. QUIZ: What Do You Know About the Pitney Bowes Model M Postage Meter? The first commercially successful postage meter revolutionized mail rooms everywhere. Test your knowledge of this ASME engineering landmark. Mechanical stamping machines were invented in the decades around 1900, but many suffered from a serious defect. What did they get wrong? They were opposed by post offices, which wanted to retain their monopoly. They had no foolproof means to stop theft. They required postal inspectors to regularly dismantle them to get data. The punctured the enveloped and often damaged letters. Here are five areas that will see an increase in AR and VR users. Sponsored Ad Cybathlon Tests the Power of Exoskeleton The Florida Institute for Human and Machine Cognition has one goal: To enable people with lower extremity paralysis to walk again. To test the limit of their exoskeleton, the IHMC team participated in the Cybathlon 2020 Global Edition, a unique championship in which people with physical disabilities pilot assistive technologies demonstrating their effectiveness in competitive races of everyday life tasks. Sponsored Content QUIZ: The Evolution of Calcium Silicate Insulation with a Corrosion Inhibitor Johns Manville's Thermo-1200Â® Calcium Silicate uses the XOX Corrosion InhibitorÂ®, which helps protect against corrosion under insulation (CUI) and makes Thermo-1200 one of the least corrosive high-temperature insulations available. Test your knowledge on how insulation and corrosion inhibitors help protect against corrosive temperatures. Insulation materials with the XOX Corrosion InhibitorÂ® were shown to decrease the proliferation of corrosion on metal surfaces by depositing a layer of protective silicates and ions onto the metal surface after water enters the system. subject: 6 Top Trends in Industrial Robots
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Test Your Knowledge of Offshore Oil Production 01.19.2021 Infographic: On the Highway, Haste Still Makes Waste According to government data, even when driving a standard passenger vehicle hard, it still gets better mileage than the most efficient trucks. However, across the board, vehicles running at 70 mph perform at about 80 percent of the efficiency than when they reach 55 mph. Sponsored Ad 6 Top Trends in Industrial Robots for 2021 The use of industrial robots in manufacturing and industrial facilities continues to evolve rapidly. Top trends for industrial robots in 2021 include collaborative robots, commercial drones, cloud robots, AI-enabled robots, customized robots, and self-healing robots. Sponsored Ad Industrial Automation - STARTS AT NEWARK Improve the efficiency and reliability of your manufacturing operations with Newark's expanded range of electromechanical components, electronic products, and test equipment â€“ for virtually any industrial application. Learn more at Newark.com! QUIZ: What Do You Know About Offshore Oil Production? Much of the world's oil production comes from ocean platforms. Reaching that oil is a major engineering challenge. Take this ASME quiz to test your knowledge of offshore oil. Although offshore oil production rose substantially starting in the 1970s, the first such wells date back much further. When and where was the first offshore oil well? Around 1891, on piles in the fresh waters of the Grand Lake St. Marys in Ohio. In 1901, on a barge floating in Lake Pontchartrain, La. Sometime before 1905, at the end of a pier in Santa Monica, Calif. In 1907, on an artificial island built in the shallow Caspian Sea in Iran. body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Test Your Knowledge on the Hyperloop 01.21.2021 Sponsored Content Infographic: Protection via Insulation-The Evolution of Thermo-1200Â® Calcium Silicate Thermo-1200Â® is a water-resistant, Type I calcium silicate pipe and block insulation, with the XOX Corrosion InhibitorÂ®. When properly installed and maintained, its superior physical strength and inorganic binders can provide an insulation lifespan of up to 25 years or more. Learn how the Thermo-1200Â® has evolved over the years. subject: Present your research at ASME's largest R&D conference
body: Text: Covering 17 tracks, we want your technical expertise. ASME's International Mechanical Engineering Congress and Exposition (IMECEÂ®) is now accepting speaking abstracts for this year's event! Taking place November 1-4, this is the largest interdisciplinary mechanical engineering R&D conference in the world. Consisting of a robust 17 tracks, roughly 1400 papers, presentations, and posters are presented. Whether you are in design and manufacturing or basic sciences, every mechanical engineering field is addressed. The breadth of research will cover critical advancements in mature fields to new and innovative areas of R&D. This is the event for engineers to present their technical expertise, while also learning from, and connecting with, thousands of their peer researchers around the world. Submit Abstract â†’ If you have any questions on the IMECE abstract process, please email congresshelp@asme.org. ABSTRACT DEADLINE: MARCH 9TH More Networking and Enhanced Q&A IMECE2021 will have improved networking capabilities on our upgraded virtual event platform and more opportunities in the program to connect with your community, some of the enhancements may include: Live, interactive Q&As enable each presenter to interact directly with attendees about their research Time-shifted Sessions enabling more global participation in presentations and Q&A Join moderated Discussion Groups or create your own group and invite your fellow attendees to a chat on a topic of your choosing More social interactivity through hosted ice-breaker session with giveaways and other opportunities for spontaneous, casual moments with other attendees. Connect at any time with other attendees to expand your network via 1:1 Chats. Learn more about the enhanced networking features and more benefits of presenting your research at IMECE2021 by visiting here. The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® )012121 - 22516 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. ABOUT US | CONTACT US | PRIVACY | UNSUBSCRIBE | MANAGE PREFERENCES Add @asme.org to your e-mail address book or safe senders to ensure delivery of ASME emails to your inbox. subject: Call for Nominations! Asia Pacific Region Group Leader (ASME Volunteer Opportunity)
body: Learning & Development Call for Nominations! ASME Asia Pacific Region Group Leader: Nominations are Open!Deadline: February 22nd, 2021Nomination Form Here â†’ Hello ASME Asia Pacific Members,Happy New Year! - Nominees are sought for the position of ASME Asia Pacific Region Group Leader (RGL) for the term starting from July 2021 to June 2023. The Asia Pacific Region currently consists of professional sections in Australia, Hong Kong, India, Japan, Malaysia, Pakistan, Singapore, South Korea and Taiwan.The Asia Pacific Region (hereinafter, â€œthe Regionâ€) Group Leader chairs the Region Leadership Team (RLT). Other responsibilities as defined in the Member Development and Engagement (MDE) Sector Operating Procedures Section 3.10 are as follows:Principal MDE Representative for the Region reporting to the Chair of the International RegionsCoordinates the formation, staffing and engagement activities of the RegionReviews and monitors Section activities, funding initiatives and metrics within the RegionMonitors Section compliance with ASME Policy and ProceduresCoordinates resolution of disputes and violations within SectionsConducts regular teleconferences with their Sections in order to provide updated information on policies, procedures and the ASME strategyCoordinates engagement opportunities between Professional & Student Sections, Early Career Engineers, Sectors and other GroupsNominees must be ASME members in good standing, and residents of the Asia Pacific Region. Nominations will be screened by a committee consisting of the Chair of the International Regions and the International Region Group Leaders to certify that nominees are qualified for the RGL position. The schedule for the selection of the ASME Asia Pacific Region Leader is as follows:Call for nominations issued: 22 January 2021Deadline for submission of nominations: 22 February 2021If you have any enquiries regarding the position, please feel free to write to me. We look forward to receiving your submission.Best Regards,Desmond Chong, PhDChair, International Regions, ASME MDE Sectordesmondchong100@gmail.comNomination Form Here â†’ This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. ABOUT US | CONTACT US | PRIVACY | UNSUBSCRIBE | MANAGE PREFERENCES Add @asme.org to your e-mail address book or safe senders to ensure delivery of ASME emails to your inbox. subject: ASME Student Membership is  Free for Freshman/First Year Students
body: Spread the Word You are already enjoying your FREE ASME Student Membership Isn't it time you let your friends in on the secret? Thank you for joining ASME as a student member and taking advantage of our Freshman/First Year Free option! Now we need your help to be sure every other eligible student knows about this great opportunity! As a student member you are the perfect ambassador to communicate the value of ASME to your Freshman/First Year friends who have yet to join. Simply point them to our quick and easy online form and they can become a student member for absolutely no-cost in just minutes! View Benefits â†’ Join Now â†’ In addition to telling your peers about this opportunity in person, you can also share ASME's Freshman/First Year Free Student Membership offer on Facebook, LinkedIn, Google+ and Twitter - or by forwarding this email or posting the offer on your university intranet - or however you wish! ASME is committed to helping mechanical engineering students reach their full potential - and with the help of students like you - we can continue to grow our global community of professional engineers and students who are working together to address the world's concerns in meaningful ways. Please help us spread the word about ASME Freshman/First Year Free Student Membership - your friends will thank you for it. View Benefits â†’ Join Now â†’ Unbeatable Benefits! ASME student membership includes benefits worth thousands of dollars that you won't find anywhere else - like unlimited use of AccessEngineering, ASME's world-class online reference tool with over 800 engineering titles. subject: The Top Tech Trends for 2021
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter The Solar Explosion of Photovoltaics 01.26.2021 Sponsored Content Why It's Time to Unify ECAD and MCAD Engineers are expected to design in both the mechanical and electrical space. A software management platform like Fusion 360 - a cloud-based, 3D CAD, CAM, CAE, and PCB, all in one tool - can unify engineers by bringing together different design elements into one platform. Sponsored Ad The Top Tech Trends for 2021 At Consumer Electronics Show, the Consumer Technology Association unveiled its top tech trends to watch for 2021. The coronavirus pandemic forced the rapid adoption of several burgeoning technologies, including 5G, digital health, and robotics. These technologies will continue to expand as we enter 2021. The Solar Explosion How did photovoltaics transform from being an expensive, niche electricity source to the least costly power on the grid? It took a triumph of industrial engineering. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR How to 3D Print Short Run Injection MoldsFebruary 16 | 2 pm ET 3D printing technology offers a cost-cutting, agile solution to quickly design and fabricate molds for small runs of thermoplastics prototypes or end-use parts. In this panel discussion, experts from the injection molding industry will discuss how 3D printing enables in-demand mold fabrication to generate hundreds of parts, from idea to production, in a matter of days. L&D CORNER Get the 2021 Virtual Classroom Schedule Virtual Classrooms are in full swing, check the schedule and reserve your seats now! Choose from new and popular courses on B31 codes; BPVC Sections III, VIII, IX, and XI; geometric dimensioning, tolerancing & Y14.5; project management & organizational leadership, and much more. Learn more at Resources.ASME.org. The American Society of Mechanical Engineers Â® ( ASMEÂ® ) 012621 - 22097 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: Understanding the Mechanics of the Coronavirus
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter A Squidbot Hits the Open Seas 01.28.2021 3D-Printed Algae Boosts Regenerative Medicine One challenge in regenerative medicine is the lack of vascularity in lab-grown tissue. Introducing algae cells through 3D printing provides oxygen to allow human cells to grow. Sponsored Ad A Squidbot Hits the Seas How do you scuttle like a cuttle? Until recently, the squid method of jet propulsion was not something found in robots. Now, researchers at the University of California San Diego have created a soft-bodied squidbot that does justice to the real thing. Mechanical Behavior of Coronaviruses Affects Their Infectivity, Lethality A study of coronaviruses' mechanical properties explains how their constant vibrations and shape-changing behavior can successfully infect human cells. Dampening their vibrations may deny access to human cells and prevent infection. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR Tolerance Stack Ups 501: Going Beyond Mechanical Fit and Into Predictive Design February 23 | 2pm ET In this live webinar, Fictiv Sr. Technical Applications Engineer David Cagle will walk you through how to take your design process to the next level. Through RSS tolerance stack-up analysis, he will teach you how to evaluate whether you need to focus or improve your tolerancing using a risk-based CPK approach. L&D CORNER Reinvent Your Career with TRIZ Problem Solving Skills TRIZ is a structured, left-brained" approach to breakthrough innovation through the use of patterns documented in the world's most inventive patents. This analysis reveals an algorithm

subject: The Biden Administration's Impact on Engineering
body: ASME TechReboot - ME Magazine Newsletter Diversity within the Air Force 01.29.2021 Manufacturing Blog: Innovations Against Risk, No Matter How Small You are more likely to win the lottery than be eaten by sharks. Inventors still think risks like that are worth avoiding. Read about some patents designed to make life a little safer. Sponsored Ad ASME TechCast: What Engineers Can Expect from the New President, Congress The Biden Administration and new Congress bring new people and policies that will affect industry. ASME's Paul Fakes talks about how that will affect engineering. Air Force Grant Fosters Diversity in Engineering A new program spearheaded by Ohio State University and co-led by Wright State University and North Carolina A&T State University aims to build lasting infrastructure to foster diversity in hiring. Its goal is to attract more minority STEM students to defense science research and other engineering careers related to the public sector. Sponsored Ad WEBINAR How to 3D Print Short Run Injection Molds February 16 | 2pm ET 3D printing technology offers a cost-cutting, agile solution to quickly design and fabricate molds for small runs of thermoplastics prototypes or end-use parts. subject: Delivery Robotics Will Transform Logistical Operations
body: The Journey from Traditional to Digital Transformation ASME TechDesign ADVERTISEMENT Digital Engineering Collection Explore Digital Innovation Read More â†’ Additive Manufacturing Collection What's New in AM Read More â†’ Infographic: Protection via Insulation - The Evolution of Thermo-1200Â® Calcium Silicate Sponsored Content Thermo-1200Â® is a water-resistant, Type I calcium silicate pipe and block insulation, with the XOX Corrosion InhibitorÂ®. When properly installed and maintained, its superior physical strength and inorganic binders can provide an insulation lifespan of up to 25 years or more. Learn how the Thermo-1200Â® has evolved over the years. Read More â†’ Video: Delivery Robots Are Poised to Transform Logistics Companies like Amazon and Tesla have big plans for sending packages via drones or robo-taxis. But delivery robots are on streets and sidewalks today. See how these autonomous robots are getting ready to come to your door. Read More â†’ ASME TechCast: The Journey from Traditional to Digital Manufacturing Sponsored Content Fictiv's platform introduces a digital manufacturing ecosystem that directly connects designers and makers with manufacturing facilities - eliminating the back and forth of traditional manufacturing. Dave Evans, CEO and co-founder of Fictiv, talks with ASME on how engineering is evolving into the realm of digital manufacturing tools. Read More â†’ ADVERTISEMENT Quiz How Much Do You Really Know about IoT? The term Internet of Things" was coined in 1999 by a Procter & Gamble employee

subject: Last Chance to Apply for ASME Scholarships - Deadlines Fast Approaching
body: ASME Scholarships for the 2021-22 academic year ASME is here to help with Scholarships! The ASME Scholarships focus on enabling a diverse cross-section of top humanitarian-involved students to become fully educated and equipped young mechanical engineers for the benefit of humankind. Don't forfeit your chance at being awarded an ASME Scholarship for the 2021-22 academic year and join a network of other ASME scholars. We have up to $400,000 to support mechanical engineering students. Apply Today â†’ Your Application Checklist âœ“ All sections of my application are complete âœ“ All necessary documents have been uploaded âœ“ My recommender's letter has been uploaded and received âœ“ My application status reads COMPLETED Application Deadlines Undergraduate student applications due February 18 Graduate student applications due March 4 High school senior applications due March 16 Questions? For questions regarding the scholarship program or applying, call toll free (U.S. applicants only) (855) 276-3734, or email us directly at ASME.University@applyISTS.com. Our offices are open Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Central. The American Society of Mechanical EngineersÂ®( ASMEÂ® )020121 - 21575 This email was sent to chandubinu10@gmail.com. subject: IRCTC' s Online Rail Ticket Reservation User Registration Confirmation
body: This is a system generated mail. Please do not reply to this email ID. If you have a query or need any clarification you may: (1) Call our 24-hour Customer Care or (2) Email Us care@irctc.co.inDear Chandu Binu,Welcome, We thank you for your registration at IRCTC' s Online Rail Ticket Reservation website. Your user id is cbabcd . Your Password is Jq61X8Q5A . Your email id Verification OTP code is : 263730You will use this user id given above for all your transaction on www.irctc.co.in. The user id cannot be changed and hence we recommend that you store this email for your future reference. We understand that you have read and agreed to the Terms and Conditions as applicable for transactions on our site. You can now make up to 6 rail reservations (up to a maximum of 6 passengers per ticket) in one calendar month. We hope to offer you a uniquely pleasant experience in planning and booking your journeys with the Indian Railways. We look forward to having you use our services regularly. In case you require any further assistance, please mail us at care@irctc.co.in or call us at 24*7 Hrs. Customer Support at %s.*************************** Information****************************** For any enquiries or information regarding your transaction with IRCTC, do not provide your credit/debit card details by any means to IRCTC. All your queries can be replied on the basis of 10 digit IRCTC Transaction id/ PNR no./User id. IRCTC does not store the credit/debit card information in any form during the transaction. ****************************************************************** Warm Regards,Customer CareInternet TicketingIRCTC * Terms & Conditions Apply

subject: Booking Confirmation
body: E-Ticket/Reservation Voucher KERALA STATE ROAD TRANSPORT CORPORATION Office of Managing Director, TRANSPORT BHAVAN, Fort, Trivandrum - 695023, Kerala, India. Telephone No.: 0471-2463799 Homepage: http://www.keralartc.com PNR NumberK6762092 Date of Journey :26-Oct-2022 Trip Code :1733PTABNG Class of Service :SWIFT-GARUDA A/C SEATER BUS Seat No(s) :35 Departure Time :19:00 Service Origin :PATHANAMTHITTA Service Destination :BANGALORE Passenger Origin :KOTTAYAM Passenger Destination :BANGALORE Boarding Point :KOTTAYAM Dropoff Point :SHANTHINAGAR BUSSTAND PF1 Platform No : Txn Password:7203 No. of Seats :1 ( Adults: 1 Children: 0 ) Passenger Information Name Age Adult/Child Gender SHONE BENNY21ADULTMale Total Fare Deatails : Original Basic Fare : 1171 Concession Fee : 0 Basic Fare : 1171 Total Levies : 69 (GST: 59.0; SRT Value: 10.0; ) Total Fare : 1257.0 (incl. of Payment Gateway Charges: 17) Enroute Refrehment Stops : Important : The seat(s) booked under this e-ticket is/are not transferable. This e-ticket/m-ticket is valid only for the seat number and busservice specified herein. This e-ticket has to be carried by the passenger during the journey along with an ID Card of the passenger whose name appears above. Please keep the ticket safely till the end of the journey. Corporation reserves the rights to change/cancel the class of service. On seats reserved for ladies, only a lady can travel. Luggage changes will be levied as per rules. Please reach the boarding point 10 minutes before start of journey. The interstate travelers who are booked the tickets in interstate state services are eligible for free travel in FAST PASSENGER and below classes of services to reach their boarding point. To avail of this offer, please carry your travel document and ID card. body: ಇ-ಟಿಕೆಟ್ / ಮೀಸಲಾತಿ ಚೀಟಿ / E-Ticket/Reservation Voucher ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ ರಾಜ್ಯ ರಸ್ತೆ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ನಿಗಮ / KARNATAKA STATE ROAD TRANSPORT CORPORATION ಕೇಂದ್ರ ಕಛೇರಿ, ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಭವನ, ಕೆ ಹೆಚ್ ರಸ್ತೆ, ಬೆಂಗಳೂರು -560027, ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ, ಭಾರತ / Central Office, Transport House, K.H ROAD, Bengaluru - 560027, Karnataka, India. ದೂರವಾಣಿ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / Telephone No.: 080-22221321 / 080-26252625 ಮುಖಪುಟ / Homepage: ksrtc.karnataka.gov.in or www.ksrtc.in ಪಿಎನ್‍ಆರ್ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / PNR NumberJ89819204ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ದಿನಾಂಕ / Date of Journey :05-Oct-2022 ಟ್ರಿಪ್‍ಕೋಡ್ / Trip Code :1820KTMBNGಸೇವೆಯ ವರ್ಗ / Class of Service :AIRAVAT CLUB CLASS ಪ್ರಾರ೦ಭ ಸ್ಥಳ / Start Place :KOTTAYAMಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಹತ್ತುವ ಸ್ಥಳ / Boarding Point :KOTTAYAM B.S ನಿರ್ಗಮನ ವೇಳೆ / Departure Time :18:20ಅಂಕಣ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / Platform No :bs ಗಮ್ಯ ಸ್ಥಳ / End Place :BENGALURUಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಇಳಿಯುವ ಸ್ಥಳ / Alighting Point :KEMPEGOWDA BS MAJESTIC ಒಟ್ಟು ಆಸನಗಳು/ Total Seats :1 ( Adults: 1 Children: 0 ) ಆಸನ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / Seat No(s) :15 ವ್ಯವಹಾರ ಗುಪ್ತಪದ / Txn Password:0803 ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಮಾಹಿತಿ / Passenger Information ಹೆಸರು / Nameವಯಸ್ಸು / Ageವಯಸ್ಕರು / ಮಕ್ಕಳು / Adult/Childಲಿಂಗ / Genderರಾಷ್ಟ್ರೀಯತೆ/NationalityDOBಪಾಸ್ಪೋರ್ಟ್ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ/Passport Noವಿಳಾಸ/Address SHONE BENNY21ADULTMaleIN-INDIA ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ದರ ವಿವರ / Fare Details in Rs.: ಮೂಲ ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ದರ / Basic Fare : 1550.0 ರಿಯಾಯಿತಿ ಮೊತ್ತ / Concession Fee : 0.0 ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸುವಿಕೆ ಶುಲ್ಕ / Reservation Fee : 10.0 ಇತರೆ ಶುಲ್ಕಗಳು / Levies : 190.0 ಜಿಎಸ್‍ಟಿ / GST : 88.0 ಒಟ್ಟು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ದರ / Total Fare : 1838.0 ಮಾರ್ಗ ಮಧ್ಯೆ ಉಪಹಾರ ಮಂದಿರಗಳು / Enroute Refrehment Stops : ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ ಸೂಚನೆ / ID Proof Note : ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಪೈಕಿ ಒಬ್ಬರು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಸ್ತುತಪಡಿಸಬೇಕಾದ ಮಾನ್ಯವಾದ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಗಳು :- ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ, ಚುನಾವಣೆ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ, ಪಾನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾಸ್‌ಪೋರ್ಟ್, ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ರೇಷನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ, ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಹಿತ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯ ಮೂಲ ಅಥವಾ ಛಾಯಾ ಪ್ರತಿ/ ಸರ್ಕಾರಿ ಇಲಾಖೆಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ / ಖಾಸಗಿ ಕಂಪೆನಿಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ/ ಶಿಕ್ಷಣ ಸಂಸ್ಥೆಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ/ ಫೋಟೋ ಇರುವ ಮೂಲ ಡೆಬಿಟ್/ಕ್ರೆಡಿಟ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್ಗಳು, ಡಿಜಿಲಾಕರ್ ಆಪ್ ಮುಖಾಂತರ ಹಾಜರುಪಡಿಸುವ ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾನ್‌ಕಾರ್ಡ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ (ಸಾಫ್ಟ್ ಪ್ರತಿ) ಯನ್ನು ಗುರುತಿನ ಮಾನ್ಯ ಪುರಾವೆಯಾಗಿ ತೋರಿಸಬಹುದಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. Valid IDs to be presented during journey by one of the passenger booked on an e-ticket:- Driving License, Voter Identity Card, PAN Card, Passport, Aadhar, Ration Card, Senior Citizen card with photograph /Original Identity Card issued by the Government Departments with photo / Original with Photo identification card issued by Private Companies/ Original with photo Identity Card issued by the Education Institutions/ Original with Photo debit / credit cards/ Aadhaar, PAN Card and Driving License Identity (Soft Copy) presented through Digilocker App considered as valid proof of identity. ವಿಶೇಷ ಸೂಚನೆಗಳು/Important information ಹೆಚ್ಚಿನ ವಿವರಗಳಿಗಾಗಿ www.ksrtc.in ನಲ್ಲಿನ ಷರತ್ತು ಹಾಗೂ ನಿಬಂಧನೆಗಳನ್ನು ಅವಲೋಕಿಸಬಹುದಾಗಿದೆ. For details, rules and terms & conditions of E-Ticketing, please visit www.ksrtc.in ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನಲ್ಲಿ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ ಆಸನಗಳನ್ನು ಇತರರಿಗೆ ವರ್ಗಾಯಿಸುವಂತಿಲ್ಲ. The seat(s) booked under this e-ticket/m-ticket is/are not transferable. ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನಲ್ಲಿ ನಮೂದಿಸಿರುವ ನಿರ್ದಿಷ್ಟ ಆಸನ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ ಮತ್ತು ಬಸ್ಸು ಸೇವೆಗೆ ಮಾತ್ರ ಮಾನ್ಯವಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. This e-ticket is valid only for the seat number and bus service specified herein. ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ತೋರಿಸದಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‍ನ್ನು “ಪ್ರಯಾಣಕ್ಕೆ ಯೋಗ್ಯವಲ್ಲದ ಟಿಕೇಟ್” ಎಂದು ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ ಹಾಗೂ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರನ್ನು “ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಇಲ್ಲದೇ ಇರುವ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು” ಎಂದು ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಇಂತಹ ಪ್ರಕರಣಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಅದೇ ವಾಹನದಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಸಲು ಇಚ್ಚಿಸಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಪೂರ್ಣ ಪ್ರಯಾಣದರ ಪಾವತಿಸಿ ನಿರ್ವಾಹಕರಿಂದ ಇಟಿಎಂ ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಪಡೆದು ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ಮುಂದುವರೆಸಬಹುದಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. E-ticket/m-ticket will become INVALID, if ID proof or e-ticket / m-ticket is not produced and passengers will be treated as 'Ticket without Passenger'. If passengers willing to travel in same service, they can resume their travel by obtaining an ETM ticket from the conductor by paying the applicable fare. ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ಸುರಕ್ಷಿತವಾಗಿ ಇಟ್ಟುಕೊಳ್ಳಬೇಕು. Passenger shall keep the e-ticket/m-ticket safely till the end of the journey. ತಪಾಸಣೆ ಸಂದರ್ಭದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ಕಡ್ಡಾಯವಾಗಿ ತೋರಿಸುವುದು. Passenger shall show the e-ticket/m-ticket and ID proof at the time of checking. ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ರಿಯಾಯಿತಿಯು ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ ರಾಜ್ಯದ ನಿವಾಸಿಗಳಿಗೆ ಮಾತ್ರ ಅನ್ವಯಿಸುತ್ತದೆ ಮತ್ತು ಇತರೆ ರಾಜ್ಯದ ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರಿಗೆ ಅನ್ವಯಿಸುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ರಿಯಾಯಿತಿ ಪಡೆದು ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಸುತ್ತಿರುವ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಂದರ್ಭದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೆಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೆಟ್ ನ ಜೊತೆಗೆ ಈ ಕೆಳಗೆ ತಿಳಿಸಿರುವ ಯಾವುದಾದರೊಂದು ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ಕಡ್ಡಾಯವಾಗಿ ತೋರಿಸುವುದು. ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ, ಚುನಾವಣೆ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ, ಪಾನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾಸ್‌ಪೋರ್ಟ್, ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ರೇಷನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಹಿತ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯ ಮೂಲ ಅಥವಾ ಛಾಯಾ ಪ್ರತಿ/ ಸರ್ಕಾರಿ ಇಲಾಖೆಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ / ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ ರಾಜ್ಯ ರಸ್ತೆ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ನಿಗಮದಿಂದ ವಿತರಿಸಲ್ಪಟ್ಟ ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ/ ಡಿಜಿಲಾಕರ್ ಆಪ್ (Digilocker App) ಮುಖಾಂತರ ಹಾಜರುಪಡಿಸುವ ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾನ್‌ಕಾರ್ಡ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ (ಸಾಫ್ಟ್ ಪ್ರತಿ). Senior Citizen concession is applicable for residents of Karnataka State only. Residents of other states are not entitled for Senior Citizen concession. Passengers travelling with Senior Citizen concession need to produce any one of the following Original ID proof at the time of journey - Driving License, Voter Identity Card, PAN Card, Passport, Aadhar, Ration Card, Senior Citizen card with photograph /Original Identity Card issued by the Government Departments with photo / Senior citizen identity card issued by KSRTC / Aadhaar, PAN Card and Driving License Identity (Soft Copy) presented through Digilocker App considered as valid proof of identity.. ಮುದ್ರಿತ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ನೊಂದಿಗೆ ನಿಗದಿತ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ ಹೊಂದಿರುವ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು, ಸದರಿ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಹೊರಡುವ ಎರಡು ಗಂಟೆ ಮುಂಚಿನ ಅವಧಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ನಗರ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಸೌಲಭ್ಯವನ್ನು ಉಚಿತವಾಗಿ ಪಡೆಯಬಹುದು (ಹವಾನಿಯಂತ್ರಿತ ಸಾರಿಗೆಗಳನ್ನು ಹೊರತುಪಡಿಸಿ). ಮೊಬೈಲ್ ಟಿಕೇಟ್ (SMS) ಆಧಾರದ ಮೇಲೆ ಉಚಿತ ನಗರ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಸೌಲಭ್ಯವನ್ನು ನೀಡಲಾಗುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. Free Travel is permitted in City Buses (except A/C buses) within the City limits before 2 Hours of the departure time on production of e-ticket print-outs only. Free travel by showing m-ticket is not allowed. ಎಲ್ಲಾ ನಿರ್ಗಮನ / ಆಗಮನದ ಸಮಯಗಳು 24 ಗಂಟೆಯ ಸ್ವರೂಪದಲ್ಲಿರುತ್ತವೆ. ಅಂದರೆ 8:00 AM (ಬೆಳಿಗ್ಗೆ) ಅನ್ನು 08:00 ಗಂಟೆಗಳು ಮತ್ತು 8:00 PM (ರಾತ್ರಿ) ಅನ್ನು 20:00 ಗಂಟೆ ಎಂದು ನಮೂದಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. All departure / arrival timings are in 24 hour format i.e 8:00 AM will be displayed as 08:00 hrs and 8:00 PM as 20:00 hrs. ಬುಕ್ ಮಾಡಿದ ಟಿಕೇಟ್‍ನ ವಿವರಗಳು ತಪ್ಪಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ರದ್ಧತಿಗೊಳಿಸಿ ಪುನಃ ಸರಿಯಾದ ವಿವರಗಳೊಂದಿಗೆ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸುವುದು. ಆನ್‍ಲೈನ್ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ರದ್ಧತಿಗೊಳಿಸಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಅರ್ಹ ಮೊತ್ತವು ಸಂಬಂಧಪಟ್ಟ ಗ್ರಾಹಕರ ಬ್ಯಾಂಕ್ ಖಾತೆಗೆ ಸಂದಾಯವಾಗಲಿದೆ. ನಗದು ಮೂಲಕ ಯಾವುದೇ ಕಾರಣಕ್ಕೂ ಹಿಂದಿರುಗಿಸಲಾಗುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. If booked e-ticket/m-ticket does not meet passenger requirements, user needs to cancel the ticket and rebook with correct details. Refunds for cancellation of online e-ticket/m-ticket will be made to customer's bank account only. Cash refunds are not allowed. ಆನ್‌ಲೈನ್‌ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ ರದ್ಧತಿ ಮಾಹಿತಿಯನ್ನು ಇ-ಮೇಲ್ ಮತ್ತು SMS ಮೂಲಕ ಖಚಿತಪಡಿಸಲಾಗುವುದು. Cancellation of online e-tickets/m-ticket by the user is confirmed through email and SMS. ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ / ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‍ಗಳನ್ನು ತೋರಿಸದಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಅಥವಾ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಕ್ಕೆ ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಬಳಸದಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಯಾವುದೇ ಮರುಪಾವತಿಗೆ ಅವಕಾಶವಿರುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. No refund is allowed for Not-showing e-ticket/m-ticket or tickets not used for travel. ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ವಾಹನ ನಿರ್ಗಮನಕ್ಕಿಂತ 10 ನಿಮಿಷ ಮುಂಚಿತವಾಗಿ ನಿಗದಿತ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರನ್ನು ಹತ್ತಿಸಿಕೊಳ್ಳುವ ಸ್ಥಳ ಪಿಕ್‍ಅಪ್ ಪಾಯಿಂಟ್‌ಗೆ ಆಗಮಿಸಲು ವಿನಂತಿಸಲಾಗಿದೆ. Passengers are requested to arrive at the Boarding / Pickup point at least 10 minutes before the scheduled time of departure of service. SMS ನ ವಿತರಣೆ (ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌, ಟ್ರಿಪ್ ಶೀಟ್ ಮಾಹಿತಿ, ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಮಾಹಿತಿ ಇತ್ಯಾದಿ) ಬಳಕೆದಾರರ ಮೊಬೈಲ್ ಸೇವಾ ಪೂರೈಕೆದಾರರ ಮೇಲೆ ಅವಲಂಬಿತವಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ ಮತ್ತು ಕರಾರಸಾನಿಗಮವು SMS ವ್ಯತ್ಯಯಕ್ಕೆ ಜವಾಬ್ದಾರರಾಗಿರುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. Delivery of SMS (m-ticket, trip sheet alerts, service alerts etc.) Depends on mobile service provider of the user and KSRTC is not responsible for the delay/ discrepancy in SMS delivery. ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ ರದ್ದುಪಡಿಸುವಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಯಾವುದೇ ಸಮಸ್ಯೆಯನ್ನು ಎದುರಿಸಿದರೆ ತಕ್ಷಣವೇ awatar@ksrtc.org ಗೆ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಮೂಲಕ ವರದಿ ಮಾಡಬೇಕಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಅಂತಹ ಮೇಲ್‌ಗಳನ್ನು ಮೇಲ್‌ನ ದಿನಾಂಕ ಮತ್ತು ಸಮಯದ ಆಧಾರದ ಮೇಲೆ ಮತ್ತು ಸೇವೆಯ ನಿರ್ಗಮನದ ಎರಡು ಗಂಟೆಗಳ ಮೊದಲು ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಅಂತಹ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಅನ್ನು ನೋಂದಾಯಿತ ಬಳಕೆದಾರ ಅಥವಾ ಅತಿಥಿ ಬಳಕೆದಾರ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಐಡಿಯಿಂದ ಮಾತ್ರ ಕಳುಹಿಸತಕ್ಕದ್ದು. ನಿಗದಿತ ಸಮಯದ ನಂತರ ಬೇರೆ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಐಡಿಯಿಂದ ಸ್ವೀಕರಿಸಿದ ಇಮೇಲ್‌ಗಳನ್ನು ಮರುಪಾವತಿಗಾಗಿ ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. If passenger faces any problem in cancellation of tickets, it needs to be reported by email to awatar@ksrtc.org, immediately. Such mails will be considered based on the date and time of the mail and upto two hours before the departure of the service. Such email shall be sent from registered user or guest user email id only. Mails received after this time or from different email id will not be considered for refund. ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ತಮ್ಮ ಲಗ್ಗೇಜಿಗೆ ತಾವೇ ಜವಾಬ್ದಾರರು. ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಂದರ್ಭದಲ್ಲಾಗಲಿ/ವಾಹನದೊಳಗಾಗಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಲಗ್ಗೇಜಿಗೆ ಕರಾರಸಾನಿಗಮವು ಜವಾಬ್ದಾರವಲ್ಲ. Any personal luggage or belongings should be taken care of by the passengers themselves. KSRTC is not responsible for passenger luggage / personal belongings inside the bus and during the journey. ಕರಾರಸಾ ನಿಗಮವು ತಪ್ಪು ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಹೊಂದಿರುವ/ಸಹ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರಿಗೆ ತೊಂದರೆ ಕೊಡುವ ಹಾಗೂ ಮದ್ಯಪಾನ ಮಾಡಿದ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರನ್ನು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದರ ಮರುಪಾವತಿ ಇಲ್ಲದೇ ಇಳಿಸುವ ಹಕ್ಕನ್ನು ಹೊಂದಿದೆ. KSRTC reserves the right to off-load passengers who are travelling on incorrect tickets, disturbing co-passengers and also drunken passengers without refund of fare. ಬಸ್ಸಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಧೂಮಪಾನ ಹಾಗೂ ಮದ್ಯಪಾನ ಮಾಡುವುದನ್ನು ನಿಷೇಧಿಸಲಾಗಿದೆ. Smoking and consumption of alcohol is strictly prohibited inside the bus. ನಿಗಮವು ಸಾರಿಗೆಯನ್ನು ರದ್ದುಪಡಿಸುವ ಅಥವಾ ವರ್ಗ ಬದಲಾಯಿಸುವ ಹಕ್ಕನ್ನು ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದೆ. Corporation reserves the rights to change/cancel the service. ಸೂಚನೆ: ಬಳಕೆದಾರರು 'ಯಾವುದೇ ಸಂಸ್ಥೆಯ ಯಾವುದೇ ವ್ಯಕ್ತಿಗೆ ತಮ್ಮ ಆನ್‌ಲೈನ್ ಬ್ಯಾಂಕಿಂಗ್ / ಕ್ರೆಡಿಟ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್ / ಡೆಬಿಟ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್ ವಿವರಗಳನ್ನು ಹಂಚಿಕೊಳ್ಳಬೇಡಿ' ಎಂದು ವಿನಂತಿಸಲಾಗಿದೆ. ವಿಚಾರಣೆಗಾಗಿ ಕಾಲ್ ಸೆಂಟರ್ 080-26252625 All users are requested 'Not to share their online banking / Credit card / Debit card details to any person from any organization. Enquiry 080-26252625. ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದವರ ಹೆಸರು/Booked By :shonebenny2@gmail.comಯಾವಾಗ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ್ದು/Booked On :04-Oct-2022 11:19 *** ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ಸುಖಕರವಾಗಿರಲಿ/WISH YOU HAPPY JOURNEY. *** Thank you. ksrtc.IN This message was sent from a notification-only email address that does not accept incoming email. Please do not reply to this message. For e-Ticketing/Refund Related Queries : onlinerefund@ksrtc.org For Other Queries: awatar@ksrtc.org
Text: Booking Confirmation ಇ-ಟಿಕೆಟ್ / ಮೀಸಲಾತಿ ಚೀಟಿ / E-Ticket/Reservation Voucher ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ ರಾಜ್ಯ ರಸ್ತೆ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ನಿಗಮ / KARNATAKA STATE ROAD TRANSPORT CORPORATION ಕೇಂದ್ರ ಕಛೇರಿ, ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಭವನ, ಕೆ ಹೆಚ್ ರಸ್ತೆ, ಬೆಂಗಳೂರು -560027, ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ, ಭಾರತ / Central Office, Transport House, K.H ROAD, Bengaluru - 560027, Karnataka, India. ದೂರವಾಣಿ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / Telephone No.: 080-22221321 / 080-26252625 ಮುಖಪುಟ / Homepage: ksrtc.karnataka.gov.in or www.ksrtc.in ಪಿಎನ್‍ಆರ್ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / PNR NumberJ89819204ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ದಿನಾಂಕ / Date of Journey :05-Oct-2022 ಟ್ರಿಪ್‍ಕೋಡ್ / Trip Code :1820KTMBNGಸೇವೆಯ ವರ್ಗ / Class of Service :AIRAVAT CLUB CLASS ಪ್ರಾರ೦ಭ ಸ್ಥಳ / Start Place :KOTTAYAMಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಹತ್ತುವ ಸ್ಥಳ / Boarding Point :KOTTAYAM B.S ನಿರ್ಗಮನ ವೇಳೆ / Departure Time :18:20ಅಂಕಣ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / Platform No :bs ಗಮ್ಯ ಸ್ಥಳ / End Place :BENGALURUಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಇಳಿಯುವ ಸ್ಥಳ / Alighting Point :KEMPEGOWDA BS MAJESTIC ಒಟ್ಟು ಆಸನಗಳು/ Total Seats :1 ( Adults: 1 Children: 0 ) ಆಸನ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ / Seat No(s) :15 ವ್ಯವಹಾರ ಗುಪ್ತಪದ / Txn Password:0803 ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಮಾಹಿತಿ / Passenger Information ಹೆಸರು / Nameವಯಸ್ಸು / Ageವಯಸ್ಕರು / ಮಕ್ಕಳು / Adult/Childಲಿಂಗ / Genderರಾಷ್ಟ್ರೀಯತೆ/NationalityDOBಪಾಸ್ಪೋರ್ಟ್ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ/Passport Noವಿಳಾಸ/Address SHONE BENNY21ADULTMaleIN-INDIA ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ದರ ವಿವರ / Fare Details in Rs.: ಮೂಲ ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ದರ / Basic Fare : 1550.0 ರಿಯಾಯಿತಿ ಮೊತ್ತ / Concession Fee : 0.0 ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸುವಿಕೆ ಶುಲ್ಕ / Reservation Fee : 10.0 ಇತರೆ ಶುಲ್ಕಗಳು / Levies : 190.0 ಜಿಎಸ್‍ಟಿ / GST : 88.0 ಒಟ್ಟು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ದರ / Total Fare : 1838.0 ಮಾರ್ಗ ಮಧ್ಯೆ ಉಪಹಾರ ಮಂದಿರಗಳು / Enroute Refrehment Stops : ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ ಸೂಚನೆ / ID Proof Note : ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಪೈಕಿ ಒಬ್ಬರು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಸ್ತುತಪಡಿಸಬೇಕಾದ ಮಾನ್ಯವಾದ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಗಳು :- ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ, ಚುನಾವಣೆ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ, ಪಾನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾಸ್‌ಪೋರ್ಟ್, ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ರೇಷನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ, ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಹಿತ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯ ಮೂಲ ಅಥವಾ ಛಾಯಾ ಪ್ರತಿ/ ಸರ್ಕಾರಿ ಇಲಾಖೆಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ / ಖಾಸಗಿ ಕಂಪೆನಿಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ/ ಶಿಕ್ಷಣ ಸಂಸ್ಥೆಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ/ ಫೋಟೋ ಇರುವ ಮೂಲ ಡೆಬಿಟ್/ಕ್ರೆಡಿಟ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್ಗಳು, ಡಿಜಿಲಾಕರ್ ಆಪ್ ಮುಖಾಂತರ ಹಾಜರುಪಡಿಸುವ ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾನ್‌ಕಾರ್ಡ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ (ಸಾಫ್ಟ್ ಪ್ರತಿ) ಯನ್ನು ಗುರುತಿನ ಮಾನ್ಯ ಪುರಾವೆಯಾಗಿ ತೋರಿಸಬಹುದಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. Valid IDs to be presented during journey by one of the passenger booked on an e-ticket:- Driving License, Voter Identity Card, PAN Card, Passport, Aadhar, Ration Card, Senior Citizen card with photograph /Original Identity Card issued by the Government Departments with photo / Original with Photo identification card issued by Private Companies/ Original with photo Identity Card issued by the Education Institutions/ Original with Photo debit / credit cards/ Aadhaar, PAN Card and Driving License Identity (Soft Copy) presented through Digilocker App considered as valid proof of identity. ವಿಶೇಷ ಸೂಚನೆಗಳು/Important information ಹೆಚ್ಚಿನ ವಿವರಗಳಿಗಾಗಿ www.ksrtc.in ನಲ್ಲಿನ ಷರತ್ತು ಹಾಗೂ ನಿಬಂಧನೆಗಳನ್ನು ಅವಲೋಕಿಸಬಹುದಾಗಿದೆ. For details, rules and terms & conditions of E-Ticketing, please visit www.ksrtc.in ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನಲ್ಲಿ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ ಆಸನಗಳನ್ನು ಇತರರಿಗೆ ವರ್ಗಾಯಿಸುವಂತಿಲ್ಲ. The seat(s) booked under this e-ticket/m-ticket is/are not transferable. ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನಲ್ಲಿ ನಮೂದಿಸಿರುವ ನಿರ್ದಿಷ್ಟ ಆಸನ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆ ಮತ್ತು ಬಸ್ಸು ಸೇವೆಗೆ ಮಾತ್ರ ಮಾನ್ಯವಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. This e-ticket is valid only for the seat number and bus service specified herein. ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ತೋರಿಸದಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‍ನ್ನು “ಪ್ರಯಾಣಕ್ಕೆ ಯೋಗ್ಯವಲ್ಲದ ಟಿಕೇಟ್” ಎಂದು ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ ಹಾಗೂ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರನ್ನು “ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಇಲ್ಲದೇ ಇರುವ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು” ಎಂದು ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಇಂತಹ ಪ್ರಕರಣಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಅದೇ ವಾಹನದಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಸಲು ಇಚ್ಚಿಸಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಪೂರ್ಣ ಪ್ರಯಾಣದರ ಪಾವತಿಸಿ ನಿರ್ವಾಹಕರಿಂದ ಇಟಿಎಂ ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಪಡೆದು ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ಮುಂದುವರೆಸಬಹುದಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. E-ticket/m-ticket will become INVALID, if ID proof or e-ticket / m-ticket is not produced and passengers will be treated as 'Ticket without Passenger'. If passengers willing to travel in same service, they can resume their travel by obtaining an ETM ticket from the conductor by paying the applicable fare. ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ಸುರಕ್ಷಿತವಾಗಿ ಇಟ್ಟುಕೊಳ್ಳಬೇಕು. Passenger shall keep the e-ticket/m-ticket safely till the end of the journey. ತಪಾಸಣೆ ಸಂದರ್ಭದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ಕಡ್ಡಾಯವಾಗಿ ತೋರಿಸುವುದು. Passenger shall show the e-ticket/m-ticket and ID proof at the time of checking. ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ರಿಯಾಯಿತಿಯು ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ ರಾಜ್ಯದ ನಿವಾಸಿಗಳಿಗೆ ಮಾತ್ರ ಅನ್ವಯಿಸುತ್ತದೆ ಮತ್ತು ಇತರೆ ರಾಜ್ಯದ ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರಿಗೆ ಅನ್ವಯಿಸುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ರಿಯಾಯಿತಿ ಪಡೆದು ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಸುತ್ತಿರುವ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಂದರ್ಭದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೆಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೆಟ್ ನ ಜೊತೆಗೆ ಈ ಕೆಳಗೆ ತಿಳಿಸಿರುವ ಯಾವುದಾದರೊಂದು ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯನ್ನು ಕಡ್ಡಾಯವಾಗಿ ತೋರಿಸುವುದು. ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ, ಚುನಾವಣೆ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ, ಪಾನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾಸ್‌ಪೋರ್ಟ್, ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ರೇಷನ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಹಿತ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿಯ ಮೂಲ ಅಥವಾ ಛಾಯಾ ಪ್ರತಿ/ ಸರ್ಕಾರಿ ಇಲಾಖೆಗಳಿಂದ ಫೋಟೋ ಸಮೇತ ವಿತರಿಸಿರುವ ಮೂಲ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ / ಕರ್ನಾಟಕ ರಾಜ್ಯ ರಸ್ತೆ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ನಿಗಮದಿಂದ ವಿತರಿಸಲ್ಪಟ್ಟ ಹಿರಿಯ ನಾಗರಿಕರ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ/ ಡಿಜಿಲಾಕರ್ ಆಪ್ (Digilocker App) ಮುಖಾಂತರ ಹಾಜರುಪಡಿಸುವ ಆಧಾರ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್, ಪಾನ್‌ಕಾರ್ಡ್ ಹಾಗೂ ಚಾಲನಾ ಪರವಾನಗಿ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ (ಸಾಫ್ಟ್ ಪ್ರತಿ). Senior Citizen concession is applicable for residents of Karnataka State only. Residents of other states are not entitled for Senior Citizen concession. Passengers travelling with Senior Citizen concession need to produce any one of the following Original ID proof at the time of journey - Driving License, Voter Identity Card, PAN Card, Passport, Aadhar, Ration Card, Senior Citizen card with photograph /Original Identity Card issued by the Government Departments with photo / Senior citizen identity card issued by KSRTC / Aadhaar, PAN Card and Driving License Identity (Soft Copy) presented through Digilocker App considered as valid proof of identity.. ಮುದ್ರಿತ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ನೊಂದಿಗೆ ನಿಗದಿತ ಗುರುತಿನ ಚೀಟಿ ಹೊಂದಿರುವ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು, ಸದರಿ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಹೊರಡುವ ಎರಡು ಗಂಟೆ ಮುಂಚಿನ ಅವಧಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ನಗರ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಸೌಲಭ್ಯವನ್ನು ಉಚಿತವಾಗಿ ಪಡೆಯಬಹುದು (ಹವಾನಿಯಂತ್ರಿತ ಸಾರಿಗೆಗಳನ್ನು ಹೊರತುಪಡಿಸಿ). ಮೊಬೈಲ್ ಟಿಕೇಟ್ (SMS) ಆಧಾರದ ಮೇಲೆ ಉಚಿತ ನಗರ ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಸೌಲಭ್ಯವನ್ನು ನೀಡಲಾಗುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. Free Travel is permitted in City Buses (except A/C buses) within the City limits before 2 Hours of the departure time on production of e-ticket print-outs only. Free travel by showing m-ticket is not allowed. ಎಲ್ಲಾ ನಿರ್ಗಮನ / ಆಗಮನದ ಸಮಯಗಳು 24 ಗಂಟೆಯ ಸ್ವರೂಪದಲ್ಲಿರುತ್ತವೆ. ಅಂದರೆ 8:00 AM (ಬೆಳಿಗ್ಗೆ) ಅನ್ನು 08:00 ಗಂಟೆಗಳು ಮತ್ತು 8:00 PM (ರಾತ್ರಿ) ಅನ್ನು 20:00 ಗಂಟೆ ಎಂದು ನಮೂದಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. All departure / arrival timings are in 24 hour format i.e 8:00 AM will be displayed as 08:00 hrs and 8:00 PM as 20:00 hrs. ಬುಕ್ ಮಾಡಿದ ಟಿಕೇಟ್‍ನ ವಿವರಗಳು ತಪ್ಪಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ರದ್ಧತಿಗೊಳಿಸಿ ಪುನಃ ಸರಿಯಾದ ವಿವರಗಳೊಂದಿಗೆ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸುವುದು. ಆನ್‍ಲೈನ್ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ರದ್ಧತಿಗೊಳಿಸಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಅರ್ಹ ಮೊತ್ತವು ಸಂಬಂಧಪಟ್ಟ ಗ್ರಾಹಕರ ಬ್ಯಾಂಕ್ ಖಾತೆಗೆ ಸಂದಾಯವಾಗಲಿದೆ. ನಗದು ಮೂಲಕ ಯಾವುದೇ ಕಾರಣಕ್ಕೂ ಹಿಂದಿರುಗಿಸಲಾಗುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. If booked e-ticket/m-ticket does not meet passenger requirements, user needs to cancel the ticket and rebook with correct details. Refunds for cancellation of online e-ticket/m-ticket will be made to customer's bank account only. Cash refunds are not allowed. ಆನ್‌ಲೈನ್‌ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್/ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ ರದ್ಧತಿ ಮಾಹಿತಿಯನ್ನು ಇ-ಮೇಲ್ ಮತ್ತು SMS ಮೂಲಕ ಖಚಿತಪಡಿಸಲಾಗುವುದು. Cancellation of online e-tickets/m-ticket by the user is confirmed through email and SMS. ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಮಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ / ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‍ಗಳನ್ನು ತೋರಿಸದಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಅಥವಾ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಕ್ಕೆ ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಬಳಸದಿದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಯಾವುದೇ ಮರುಪಾವತಿಗೆ ಅವಕಾಶವಿರುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. No refund is allowed for Not-showing e-ticket/m-ticket or tickets not used for travel. ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ವಾಹನ ನಿರ್ಗಮನಕ್ಕಿಂತ 10 ನಿಮಿಷ ಮುಂಚಿತವಾಗಿ ನಿಗದಿತ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರನ್ನು ಹತ್ತಿಸಿಕೊಳ್ಳುವ ಸ್ಥಳ ಪಿಕ್‍ಅಪ್ ಪಾಯಿಂಟ್‌ಗೆ ಆಗಮಿಸಲು ವಿನಂತಿಸಲಾಗಿದೆ. Passengers are requested to arrive at the Boarding / Pickup point at least 10 minutes before the scheduled time of departure of service. SMS ನ ವಿತರಣೆ (ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌, ಟ್ರಿಪ್ ಶೀಟ್ ಮಾಹಿತಿ, ಸಾರಿಗೆ ಮಾಹಿತಿ ಇತ್ಯಾದಿ) ಬಳಕೆದಾರರ ಮೊಬೈಲ್ ಸೇವಾ ಪೂರೈಕೆದಾರರ ಮೇಲೆ ಅವಲಂಬಿತವಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ ಮತ್ತು ಕರಾರಸಾನಿಗಮವು SMS ವ್ಯತ್ಯಯಕ್ಕೆ ಜವಾಬ್ದಾರರಾಗಿರುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. Delivery of SMS (m-ticket, trip sheet alerts, service alerts etc.) Depends on mobile service provider of the user and KSRTC is not responsible for the delay/ discrepancy in SMS delivery. ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ ರದ್ದುಪಡಿಸುವಲ್ಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಯಾವುದೇ ಸಮಸ್ಯೆಯನ್ನು ಎದುರಿಸಿದರೆ ತಕ್ಷಣವೇ awatar@ksrtc.org ಗೆ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಮೂಲಕ ವರದಿ ಮಾಡಬೇಕಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಅಂತಹ ಮೇಲ್‌ಗಳನ್ನು ಮೇಲ್‌ನ ದಿನಾಂಕ ಮತ್ತು ಸಮಯದ ಆಧಾರದ ಮೇಲೆ ಮತ್ತು ಸೇವೆಯ ನಿರ್ಗಮನದ ಎರಡು ಗಂಟೆಗಳ ಮೊದಲು ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಅಂತಹ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಅನ್ನು ನೋಂದಾಯಿತ ಬಳಕೆದಾರ ಅಥವಾ ಅತಿಥಿ ಬಳಕೆದಾರ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಐಡಿಯಿಂದ ಮಾತ್ರ ಕಳುಹಿಸತಕ್ಕದ್ದು. ನಿಗದಿತ ಸಮಯದ ನಂತರ ಬೇರೆ ಇಮೇಲ್ ಐಡಿಯಿಂದ ಸ್ವೀಕರಿಸಿದ ಇಮೇಲ್‌ಗಳನ್ನು ಮರುಪಾವತಿಗಾಗಿ ಪರಿಗಣಿಸಲಾಗುವುದಿಲ್ಲ. If passenger faces any problem in cancellation of tickets, it needs to be reported by email to awatar@ksrtc.org, immediately. Such mails will be considered based on the date and time of the mail and upto two hours before the departure of the service. Such email shall be sent from registered user or guest user email id only. Mails received after this time or from different email id will not be considered for refund. ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ತಮ್ಮ ಲಗ್ಗೇಜಿಗೆ ತಾವೇ ಜವಾಬ್ದಾರರು. ಪ್ರಯಾಣದ ಸಂದರ್ಭದಲ್ಲಾಗಲಿ/ವಾಹನದೊಳಗಾಗಲಿ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರ ಲಗ್ಗೇಜಿಗೆ ಕರಾರಸಾನಿಗಮವು ಜವಾಬ್ದಾರವಲ್ಲ. Any personal luggage or belongings should be taken care of by the passengers themselves. KSRTC is not responsible for passenger luggage / personal belongings inside the bus and during the journey. ಕರಾರಸಾ ನಿಗಮವು ತಪ್ಪು ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಹೊಂದಿರುವ/ಸಹ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರಿಗೆ ತೊಂದರೆ ಕೊಡುವ ಹಾಗೂ ಮದ್ಯಪಾನ ಮಾಡಿದ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರನ್ನು ಪ್ರಯಾಣದರ ಮರುಪಾವತಿ ಇಲ್ಲದೇ ಇಳಿಸುವ ಹಕ್ಕನ್ನು ಹೊಂದಿದೆ. KSRTC reserves the right to off-load passengers who are travelling on incorrect tickets, disturbing co-passengers and also drunken passengers without refund of fare. ಬಸ್ಸಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಧೂಮಪಾನ ಹಾಗೂ ಮದ್ಯಪಾನ ಮಾಡುವುದನ್ನು ನಿಷೇಧಿಸಲಾಗಿದೆ. Smoking and consumption of alcohol is strictly prohibited inside the bus. ನಿಗಮವು ಸಾರಿಗೆಯನ್ನು ರದ್ದುಪಡಿಸುವ ಅಥವಾ ವರ್ಗ ಬದಲಾಯಿಸುವ ಹಕ್ಕನ್ನು ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದೆ. Corporation reserves the rights to change/cancel the service. ಸೂಚನೆ: ಬಳಕೆದಾರರು 'ಯಾವುದೇ ಸಂಸ್ಥೆಯ ಯಾವುದೇ ವ್ಯಕ್ತಿಗೆ ತಮ್ಮ ಆನ್‌ಲೈನ್ ಬ್ಯಾಂಕಿಂಗ್ / ಕ್ರೆಡಿಟ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್ / ಡೆಬಿಟ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್ ವಿವರಗಳನ್ನು ಹಂಚಿಕೊಳ್ಳಬೇಡಿ' ಎಂದು ವಿನಂತಿಸಲಾಗಿದೆ. ವಿಚಾರಣೆಗಾಗಿ ಕಾಲ್ ಸೆಂಟರ್ 080-26252625 All users are requested 'Not to share their online banking / Credit card / Debit card details to any person from any organization. Enquiry 080-26252625. ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದವರ ಹೆಸರು/Booked By :shonebenny2@gmail.comಯಾವಾಗ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ್ದು/Booked On :04-Oct-2022 11:19 *** ಪ್ರಯಾಣ ಸುಖಕರವಾಗಿರಲಿ/WISH YOU HAPPY JOURNEY. *** Thank you. ksrtc.IN This message was sent from a notification-only email address that does not accept incoming email. Please do not reply to this message. For e-Ticketing/Refund Related Queries : onlinerefund@ksrtc.org For Other Queries: awatar@ksrtc.org

subject: KSRTC AWATAR - OB Reference No.
body: E-Ticket OB-Ref KARNATAKA STATE ROAD TRANSPORT CORPORATION Central Office, Transport House, K.H ROAD, Bengaluru - 560027, Karnataka, India. Telephone No.: 080-22221321 / 080-26252625 Homepage: ksrtc.karnataka.gov.in or www.ksrtc.in Transaction Reference No.:OB51506810 Total Ticket amount.:1838 ವಿಶೇಷ ಸೂಚನೆಗಳು/IMPORTANT INSTRUCTIONS: ಪ್ರಯಾಣಿಕರು ಈ ವಹಿವಾಟಿನ ಸಂಖ್ಯೆಯನ್ನು ದಾಖಲಿಸಿಕೊಳ್ಳಲು ಕೋರಲಾಗಿದೆ. ಕ.ರಾ.ರ.ಸಾ. ನಿಗಮದೊಂದಿಗಿನ ಮುಂದಿನ ವ್ಯವಹಾರಕ್ಕೆ ಇದು ಅತ್ಯಗತ್ಯವಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ (Passengers are requested to note this transaction no. It will be required for any further correspondence with KSRTC). ಒಂದೇ ಪ್ರಯಾಣಕ್ಕಾಗಿ ಮತ್ತೊಂದು ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಲು ಮುಂದುವರೆಯುವ ಮುನ್ನ, ಮೊದಲು ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ ಟಿಕೇಟಿನ ಸ್ಥಿತಿಯನ್ನೊಮ್ಮೆ ಪರಿಶೀಲಿಸಲು ಕೋರಲಾಗಿದೆ (Passengers are requested to check transaction status before proceeding to book another ticket for the same journey). ಯಶಸ್ವಿಯಾಗಿ ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನ್ನು ಮುಂಗಡ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದಾಗ ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನ್ನು ಇ-ಮೇಲ್ ಮೂಲಕ ಮತ್ತು ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನ್ನು ಎಸ್‌ಎಂಎಸ್ ಮೂಲಕ ಕಳುಹಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಆದಾಗ್ಯೂ ಎಸ್‌ಎಂಎಸ್‌ನ ವಿತರಣೆಯು ಬಳಕೆದಾರರ ಮೊಬೈಲ್ ಸೇವಾ ಪೂರೈಕೆದಾರರ ನೆಟ್‌ವರ್ಕ್ ಲಭ್ಯತೆ ಮತ್ತಿತರ ಸಂಬಂಧಿತ ಅಂಶಗಳ ಮೇಲೆ ಅವಲಂಬಿತವಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ (For successful booking, ticket will be sent by mail (eticket) and SMS (mticket). However, delivery of SMS depends on mobile service provider of user, network availability and other related issues). ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಮೊತ್ತ ಕಡಿತಗೊಂಡು ಇ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಮತ್ತು ಎಂ-ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನ್ನು ಸ್ವೀಕರಿಸದ ಪ್ರಕರಣಗಳಲ್ಲಿ, ನಿಗಮದ ವೆಬ್‌ಸೈಟ್ www.ksrtc.in ನಲ್ಲಿನ “PNR Enquiry- Transaction Status” ಮೂಲಕ ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ನ ಸ್ಥಿತಿಯನ್ನು ಪರಿಶೀಲಿಸಬಹುದಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ. ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ ವಹಿವಾಟನ್ನು ಯಶಸ್ವಿ ವಹಿವಾಟೆಂದು ಪಿಎನ್‌ಆರ್ ಸಮೇತ ಗುರುತಿಸಲಾಗುತ್ತದೆ. ಮುಂಗಡ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸದ ವಹಿವಾಟನ್ನು ವೈಫಲ್ಯ ವಹಿವಾಟೆಂದು ಗುರುತಿಸಲಾಗುವುದು (For transactions where eticket and mticket are not received, but payment deducted, you can check transaction status on our website(www.ksrtc.in), link PNR Enquiry - Transaction Status". Booked tickets will be listed as "Success" transactions with PNR no. Tickets not booked will be listed as "Failure" status). ಮುಂಗಡ ಕಾಯ್ದಿರಿಸಿದ ಟಿಕೇಟ್‌ಗಳನ್ನು “PNR Enquiry - PNR Status” ನಿಂದ ಪರಿಶೀಲಿಸÀಬಹುದಾಗಿರುತ್ತದೆ (Booked tickets can be viewed from link "PNR Enquiry - PNR Status"). ಟಿಕೇಟ್ ಮೊತ್ತ ಕಡಿತಗೊಂಡು ವಹಿವಾಟು ವಿಫಲಗೊಂಡ ಪ್ರಕರಣಗಳಲ್ಲಿ ಕಡಿತಗೊಂಡ ಮೊತ್ತವನ್ನು ಸಂಬಂಧಪಟ್ಟ ಖಾತೆಗೆ ಏಳು ಕೆಲಸದ ದಿನಗಳೊಳಗಾಗಿ ವರ್ಗಾವಣೆ ಮಾಡಲಾಗುವುದು (Refunds for failure transactions
